2DJpjMYkOhsPRyTLPbVOXw.text: Bold flavors, super fresh ingredients, and VERY friendly employees. This place is like Chipotle for Mediterranean food, without the chain restaurant feel. We stopped here after arriving at PHX and picking up our rental car at the Enterprise right down the street. We were totally starving and Yelp saved the day! We must have looked a little lost when we walked in because an employee immediately offered to walk us through the process. I ordered a bowl with saffron rice, gyro meat, roasted red pepper hummus, lentils, and lots of fresh veggies. It was absolutely delicious. And there was a check-in offer for one of their fresh brewed teas - score! All in all, this place deserves 5 stars. I would seriously eat at Hummus Xpress multiple times a week if I lived in the area.

4n_x2FjElKRjfRtDFArN7A.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in the hood. It's quick and you get a ton of food. The cilantro jalapeno sauce is good on errythang.

pfvYTunjmZb0jVkbXr5DCg.text: Great food.  Great service.  If you want to treat your taste buds this is the place to go!

XwqFbknU51dVxxymjncX_A.text: This is a good spot if you are looking for a quick, cheap, and relatively healthy meal.  Also, while I dont eat it, the meat looks great and I saw them butchering it themselves in the back.  The chef explained that they cook it overnight at a low temperature...sounded and looked delicious.  This is also a solid spot for the vegetarians here.  Lot of options, and a lot of food-you will not leave hungry.  The reason its 4 and not 5 stars is simple: I would prefer them to give the customer the option of putting all of the different foods in seperate containers instead of meshing them alltogether in one bowl.  I would prefer to be able to taste the hummus, tzaziki, tahini, etc all seperately as they are delicious in their own right.  As it stands now, they serve it all together in one bowl and tastes fine, but you cannot differentiate between all of their different foods.

OxyzbqvW0j3mwKrzQ9R6MQ.text: I happened to notice this place as I was driving by looking for somewhere to grab lunch.  Ever since making the switch to vegan after already being gluten-free, finding something good to eat that is also convenient has been a challenge!  The name alone was enough to convince me that I should try it out and I was pleasantly surprised to find that almost everything is gluten-free and most everything (other than the meat, of course) was also vegan!  I had a bowl with veggies, hummus and salad and it was delicious!  Not to mention everyone working was super friendly and helpful!  There was even live music during lunch!  What a cool spot.  Will definitely be back!

b2d0CPDy3EIiKCu5TWOD8A.text: I love this place! The food is incredible, its so fresh and delicious. I work nearby and visit frequently. Vegetarians and meat eaters will love this place!

gBUF1r0yI8MqZ23VqkX1NA.text: Amazing food, friendly staff and did I already say the dood was AMAZING?! Fresh and flavorful dishes consistently.  No complaints here... if you love hummus and/or Mediterranean food, do your tastebuds a favor and try HUMMUS XPRESS!!!

ZMN6Rt8_fkz-R7hZsBnM_A.text: Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Tempe, if not the valley!  Super flavorful and authentic. Plus the employees are very friendly and helpful. The eggplant and falafel are my favorite things there. All of the hummus is delicious. So many options to choose from!

2xq4RWThoQy5RTdT7-sa1w.text: Tried this place today and it was BOMB the gyro bowl was amazing. The staff was friendly and funny. Def will be back

VAhcb3CH5-wtgtv1Z2Uwmw.text: Delicious!  I got the "plate". You get to pick 2 meats the gyro was tender and very flavorful and melted in my mouth, I got the jalapeno cilantro hummus and al the sides you want with a warmed up pita.  Filled me up and hit the spot!

ba1qflLLh8x6wU6SR8jymw.text: OMG this place killed it.. outstanding grub.. unique concept and flavor bombs that tantalize the taste buds. . Oh and super friendly staff!

Cq7QnlMg9glVgaQaljWjjA.text: Yep, that's 5 stars. I've been waiting to write my 100th review for someplace special. This place is great. Very much as everyone has reported previously it's a Mediterranean Chipotle, but better.  It's a small place in an older strip mall but nice inside. You get a choice of everything. I ordered a bowl with the most beautifully marinated, tender chicken, grilled zucchini, cooked kale, a quinoa salad with garbanzos in lemony dressing, jalapeno and cilantro hummus, extra toppings and a whole wheat pita. So much food but healthy. A lot of garlic which I'm sure all of my co-workers appreciated since I ate it at my desk. But I'm fairly sure they were just jealous they weren't eating it. All this for about $8.  Highly recommend.

MF1wvcpHvhd08e5LWTzuWA.text: This place has a really good hummus selection and the veggies and sauces they have to accompany everything is spiced and just delicious. I've been there a few times and I like my creation every time :) Good price too!

4N1R1NgOlj4QgTMszOu7dg.text: A-may-zing.   Think Chipotle-style, pick your stuff, but for Middle Eastern food. If they have this same stuff each day, I could eat here daily.  If you have not been here, you are missing out. I highly suggest you stop by.  I got a bowl and all vegan ingredients: chipotle hummus, beet hummus, tabboule, kale, falafel, etc.  Can't wait till we have like 6 or 7 of these in town.

WCh4m6cYDoPJcvjnM_mHDQ.text: This place has some of the best Mediterranean food in the valley. I had a bowl which is very well served, all the toppings are fresh, you get a choice of a protein I tied the braised beef and it is excellent. Then you get to choose as many toppings as you want. I highly recommend this place.

TBJQH-R7bYV55hDEpVx_Kg.text: This place is pretty good.  The portions are pretty good sized, I got a Gyro and my wife got a falafel pita.  Both were really tasty.  We got the red pepper hummus which was about the only minor disappointment.  It didn't taste bad, but it was thin in consistency so that included with everything else made the pita soggy.  I am anxious to try other things there though, lots of variety.

LSqUrSFXxb2yEMlE84nNww.text: Food is delicious! I have eaten here a few times and have had a good experience every time. The food is fast and fresh. My favorite hummus is chipotle. I'm not usually a big fan of eggplant but I love theirs!

izfZmlCSIfqtBalHbSgYoQ.text: The best in Tempe for a fast, filling and healthy meal! Their falafel is the best I've ever had.

KJWP7KCuqZu7Dhb9lX4XSg.text: My friend told me about this place and I had tried their hummus before and loved it. We went tonight and I got the gyro bowl. The gyro meat was seasoned and cooked perfectly. You get to choose your meat and a grilled vegetable. Then you get to choose between 3 salads and a choice of hummus. You also get to choose your sauce and toppings. The staff is so nice and the food is so good and very fair priced. We will be back!

K43nS3TZlvlaNNp-o1ob4w.text: Tried this for the first time today with my room mate. I insisted on Burger King, and thank goodness we didn't go there! This place is authentic, tasty, cheap and filling. I'm currently rolling around in bed making whale noises because I cannot believe how much middle eastern food I just consumed. I will definitely recommend and tell all my middle eastern cuisine loving college student friends that this is the spot!!

z_Uwzbz0fYTmQHPXebeetg.text: ** Updating because sometimes technology sucks **  Don't take my word for it, go try it for yourself.  The Chipotle of Mediterranean food indeed. So good.  Chicken/rice/tabouli/veggies/hummus/feta/olives/cucumbers MMMMM.  |  I'll be back.

vNPH8yQQ_bBw1W1e2b8oNQ.text: This place is such a refreshing change of pace from all the other mediterranean joints that serve the same old falafel, hummus, pita. etc. Hummus Xpress is an exciting new addition to that boring line up.   I've been wanting to try out the restaurant  for awhile after seeing it featured in the New Times, but I rarely find myself in Tempe. I ended up taking my parents there before seeing a show at Gammage. We all left very full and happy.  The owner explained all the menu and all the offerings for the day. I got a falafel plate which was a ton of food. It comes with one veggie side, but the owner threw in a few bites of all of them so I could try them out. The falafel was fantastic, and I fell instantly in love with the spicy carrots. I got the lemon ginger and beet hummuses since those were the most unusual sounding. They were both super good, and more unique than the standard hummus I make at home.  My parents were happy with their meat based dishes. I thought it was interesting that one of the choices was brisket. Unexpected for a mediterranean place, but that's the beauty of Hummus Xpress.

m_FIiRMumIB8bzJg7Ows_g.text: Build a hummus bowl with your favorite grains and veggies? Um, yes please. This place is just awesome - the food is delicious, the staff is seriously nice, and it's very friendly to people who are veg or vegan or GF. It's also a great amount of food for the price. This is one of those restaurants that just makes you feel good after you eat there.   Bonus: I know 99.99999% of the population doesn't care about the celery content of their food, but I am severely allergic and it was a huge relief to be told no celery is used anywhere here!

ljTGUowVpYbGe7W2I--X-g.text: Excellent Fast/Casual Middle Eastern Style Food featuring a variety of unique Hummus and many interesting toppings.   It is a little confusing on how to order and is easier to understand when you read the website. The Main Menu is $6.45-$9.95.   Your best option for sampling the most amount of offerings is "the plate" so I went for that. I walked in front of the glass front buffet and the helpful people behind the glass served.   When you get "The Plate" They start with a really delicious Rice. You get TWO Protein Options. I went for the Flavorful Moist Brisket and the Lebanese Falafels. Since I got the brisket the Chef recommended a little Beef sauce over my rice and it was a really great suggestion. Then I got TWO vegetables Sides, yummy spicy carrots and crisp lemon broccoli. Next came Hummus and you either get one king or they split it and you get two. With all the flavors they offer I suggest getting two as I had the Beet root Hummus and the Original. You then get a salad choice and I picked Tabbouleh.  Believe it or not your not done yet.  Next are a large variety of pans of all kinds of vegetables and condiments and sauces and you pick whatever you like and get a pita too.  I picked Pickled Beets and some kind of Onion dish and really delicious Schug Sauce.  Now I'm at the end of the line and pay. Get my Cup for beverage and seat myself.  Everything was so delicious. I never had a Lebanese Style Falafel before and it seemed very different but also very good. The beef I tried was moist and flavorful and not too fatty. The rice was really, Really Good. I thought the carrots were super yummy. The pickled beets were almost crunchy with a really interesting flavor. Of course the Hummus was very good and that Schug Sauce was very aromatic and delicious. The shrug sauce had some kick to it but is a milder more herbal version of others I've tasted before but was certainly just as delicious.  Very Above Average Middle Eastern Style Food in a very casual and quick atmosphere.   4.5 Stars  P.S. No I wasn't able to finish my plate and took 1/2 home for latter.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. $9.95 Plate included a Pita

G8Ry1qyFZjeST29a7NP4Mw.text: Never been here before, but friends picked it. Not really my type of food. The employees were extremely helpful and the food was awesome. I ate off their recommendation based of what I said I typically like so I don't remember exactly what it was. I just know I want it again.

ZRZ7ktw-ngXbfnu0B_N-4Q.text: You should go there either early or late if it is your first time and you are not sure what to order. The food is ok and I will go there again. Recommended:-)

y5xvU2eKXUvriQGj7AnY0g.text: I've been waiting to go to this place!!!!!! Let's say third time is a charm! Hummus xpress was finally open! I ordered the plate with lamb gyro and beef brisket!!! Mmmmm! The goodness didn't stop there.  I went for the beet and chipotles hummus, all the sides (I love vegetables) and you must know their is unlimited toppings of your choosing. To top it off I got garlic aioli and taZiki. I'll be back before my flight out!  I also received free tea with the yelp deal and finished off dinner with a pistachio baklava.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Deliciousness

PyrvAylwcjQDJs1im4oCbg.text: Loved my lunch veggie plate. All of the ingredients had their own flavor and texture, although some people may not like having everything piled on top of each other in the bowl. Doesn't bother me! Hummus was very delicious. Different than others around. I need to get more so I can put my finger on it. The jalapeno hummus was actually spicy which I've never had before. Other places just don't add enough I guess lol The eggplant was tough and tasted like it was out for awhile so I'll probably skip that next time (I came in at noon so not sure why so stale? ). The pita was very elastic and glutenous which I did not care for but it's not important for a plate. Didn't need it but I would've loved a more bready pita that's just my taste though. space is small and parking limited so plan accordingly.  Employees were efficient and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

jSDd8ZRlYSo07SZedcjTVg.text: I have a couple of slogans for this place: The Mediterranean/middle eastern version of chipotle! Or Healthy fast food! I was pleasantly surprised! Wasn't sure what to expect, and what I found was a large variety of vegetables (perfect for vegetarians or vegans), meats, toppings and of course: HUMMUS. The service was very friendly and they allowed me to taste all 6 types of hummus. The hummus options included original/unique flavors such as: beets or all-spice infused; each type was tasty in its own right. Ordered a bowl with lots of different grilled veggies, chicken, tabouli, pickled veggies as well as a very pungent yet tasty garlic aioli! I will be back!

_uyBKLknBZamgVL_h-390Q.text: One Tempe's highlights! You can basically build tour own dish like at Chipotle. A bowl for example starts with rice, a choice of meat or two veggies, salads (lentils, beans etc), hummus (such as ginger - lemon,  jalapeno, cilantro, plain etc.) and all sorts of fresh toppings like veggies, lettuce, cheese, olives etc and last but not least a sauce (garlic aioli, Chili, yogurt etc). It is served with a pit (wheat or white). Simple but sooo good and also somewhat healthy compared to other fast foods!

QcwLdeGod_k57cExLcbBjw.text: This was my first time going here. Being stuck at a hotel all week long I wanted to try something different. I basically found this thru Yelp and the reason I went was because of the good reviews they had.  Service: The guys there were really friendly and guided me thru the choosing process. Food: It was great, I had the small bowl but it was enough to fill me up. Chicken had a good flavor, rice was delicious. Every bite that I took was full of flavor. If u like Spicy food the Jalapeno hummus is delicious. Lentils and garbanzos were good as well as the brocoli. Price: affordable I only paid $8.71 for the small bowl Cons: didnt really like the garlic sauce but then again not a big fan of garlic. The sweet tea looked old. (Only reasons I gave it a 4 star, I really wanted to get my free house brewed tea offered by Yelp).   Food is delicious I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. My Dinner

dVKmeIDx7EPlOSTqJw5IuQ.text: Nice large Greek style plates. The meats are well cooked with good seasoning and flavor. The pita isn't the best, so no need to ger more on the side. The side salad is worth the price and a good substitute if your going low calorie. The price is amazing for the amount of food you get. Unfortunately, i keep comparing it to Greek food in NYC, and it doesn't hold its own. Hence the 4 stars. Use ubereats, and have it delivered right to your place. It's a great dinner for one of those at home Netflix nights. If you want $10 off your order use my code eats-mbdvx.

-5D4O4MoRIvyTJ4SZUd4fw.text: All of the food here is amazing and the service is outstanding - I would certainly recommend this place to anyone looking for really good Mediterranean food.

0mM4ldXRm4jimtO3IwogOA.text: I ordered delivery through Uber eats.  Food was delivered quickly, but incomplete.  Ordered baklava, waters, extra protein and sauce and didn't get it.  The food itself tasted good, no complaints there, but disappointing that my order was wrong.

bBdjN1PQKJWzdsWqsxlUcQ.text: I eat here a few times a month and the quality of their food is always consistently great.   I always get a plate, sometimes it is almost two meals depending on how hungry I am.  Totally recommend going, except on the lunches when I am in a hurry and don't want to wait in line.    ha. =)

2UqC4p5xxUfqvzBt1SRNnw.text: Delicious and filling.  I had the small bowl and although it looked small a first, once you start piling the toppings it becomes a large salad!  The employees were nice and one walked me through the options and was patient as I reviewed what everything was.  It was filling and I even had leftovers.

CHlKQJUmh_3kftAzoYNwrw.text: I love this concept! It's like chipotle bowls but Mediterranean. I love all the flavors!  Pita Jungle should grab this concept or Hummus Express should branch out!  I would eliminate the front window display of bad cactus and vegetation. That is so not appealing as the first presentation we see for this amazing restaurant.

QMp2bpHwFvRTY40_EI1wWA.text: Solid 4.5 of 5 stars - top notch, top notch (manic clapping).  My colleague suggested we all dine here this past Friday and I'm so glad she did! It's only a 5 min drive from my office and GOOD!!   We were going to get our lunches to go, because every table was occupied, but the stars were aligned and we got in the back bistro tables. Loud, very loud lunch crowd. Again, my ears are sensitive so the volume pains me and makes me rage, mean-mug the perps, and run outside. And choice of music was Country/Western in a Mediterranean/Middle Eastern fast food place? Errr... Nooooooo. Never, ever do that again, please. Not a fan of that genre but doesn't jive w the flavor of the joint. I need exotic sort of pop music from Lebanon or some shit...  The beautiful thing is that you build whatever you want to eat! It was a little daunting and laborious to use my brain during my lunch but I got in my flow. Tried the salad bowl with gyro meat, spicy hummus, grilled eggplant, and tzatziki sauce. Soooo wonderful; slightly different taste in every bite if you don't mix it, which is fun.  I ordered a piece of warm pita bread w salad but I think they should automatically throw this in for salad bowls... Don't you?? Haha  I'll return very soon for more dining experiences!

TJGAJZjxMlF_Lk9bZmFa2w.text: Reading the previous reviews I feel like I missed something. Wanted a gyro today and thought I would try someplace new. Went in and the gentlemen working the counter were very nice and explained how everything worked and made some suggestions. I was already planning on a gyro so I went with that.   The pita was very good and ended up being the best part of the meal. The meat was swimming in oil/grease to the point where it was hard to choke down. The flavor was ok, but they were thick hunks that seemed like they were fried in oil to make them crispy. I generally prefer a more shaved gyro but my issue is more with all the grease pouring off the meat. The tzatziki sauce was very bitter and they used a ton of it. It was like having tzatziki meat soup served on a pita. I actually ended up scraping most of it off. It also didn't sit with me very well after the fact. I can't imagine I'll be back but based on all the good reviews, maybe it was just an off day.

MzxemVu5PXFxeQWpMXa9ZQ.text: For what it is, Hummus Xpress is fantastic.  Quick, casual, Chipotle style ordering.  And if you order a 'plate' for $10, you're really getting two or three meals.  Everything I've had here has been good or great, standouts are all the hummus, the eggplant, and the tabouli salad  Don't drive across town for it, but definitely hit them up if you're in the area

V_KROOobJMatDT4Qz-K9bA.text: My favorite place to get the most delicious hummus bowl.  I try to visit this place at least once a week for lunch and I love it!  Thanks for always accepting my Yelp check in for a free iced tea. Ice tea is made fresh and is superb!

QW0JRyQ4lsBTtf_RM0ozZw.text: This place is amazing. Nice little gem in Tempe. A nice variety of hummus my favorite being the chipotle hummus. The food is fresh and delicious and the staff is friendly and very good service. Enjoy!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. My master piece creation

I3ZvBZSu9gTlUPC_3KR73Q.text: Definitely not the prettiest food out there and I was a little confused how to order but the service was great and the food was tasty. I'll be back for more!

6upDZXqGo8wzgI8cEf1vjA.text: I am giving this place 5 stars for the food and friendly staff.   I had a pita with hummus, rice, veggies.  The pita was fresh and soft and might be the best one I ever had.  The red pepper hummus was perfect.... Not overwhelmed by garlic as you find some restaurants serve. The veggies were wonderful... Cooked just right.  I had a piece of baklava for dessert that was pretty good.  The staff was genuinely friendly and very efficient.  I will definitely be back!

MfuHQ16Wea2PQ7sr8O87Jw.text: The service was really good; the girl behind the counter offered great service for a first time customer who didn't know the ordering procedure. However, I was not impressed with the food; it was ok. I ordered hummus with gyro meat. The meat consistancy is chunked and moist. The "classic hummus" is not the same as traditional hummus; their classic contains garlic and has more of a chunky consistancy rather than thick and smooth. Overall, it was ok, but I will stick to the more traditional Mediterranean restaurants.

keyYw0pFmEmipsbTAN_A7A.text: I had a FANTASTIC lunch date here with my husband today. They had live music (not sure why) but it didn't last long.   The food was SOOOOO tasty. It was nice to have so many side vegetable options. I got to try a huge variety of food (3 sides, 2 kids of hummus, 1 protein, and all the toppings you can want).  It was a lite and refreshing lunch. The service was EXCELLENT (i.e. the guys behind the counter were really nice). I'll be going back a lot.

YuQvdxWauuyReq14kqUpyw.text: EXCELLENT food here. Very affordable and delicious, good for pickup but not so much a sit-down place.

HOCVGXo7dEV2QLznv5Fj2w.text: Dare I say this is the best Mediterranean food I've ever head?   Just kidding, I haven't eaten in hours and I'm starving. Real talk: the food here is dope and prices are great. Tons of awesome and flavorful hummuses and sauces, fresh ingredients, and very friendly servers.  Come here for a satisfying, cheap and casual meal!   DC people who find their way here - it's like an even better version of Cava.

MkPqJOWMdGgEVS8YGrtNFQ.text: If you like garlic, you'll love Hummus Xpress. They do not hold back! I don't know if it was any one item or everything but I had garlic mouth for the rest of the night. Luckily my boyfriend and I both got dinner so it was okay - haha!  But besides sweating garlic I really liked this place. I love the Chipotle-style way of doing the food. I got a bowl with rice, beef, carrots, quinoa salad, classic hummus and tahini sauce. Everything was super fresh and flavorful. Some of the beef pieces were a tad on the dry side but overall it was good. Maybe it had been sitting a while? Also, the tatziki sauce was too strong for my taste so I would skip that next time. It's a lot of food. I ate half and was full so if you're like me you can easily get two meals out of a bowl.  Boyfriend has been looking for good falafel for a while now and he said it was very good. It must have been because he ate it all before I could try any!  The guys working behind the counter were really nice too. They were very patient and explained everything to us noobs. I will definitely be back for more!

nMkDNtloeJy7AouEhnC4fg.text: This place rocks! Just enjoyed a terrific lunch, I will be back on a regular basis. You will not be disappointed in the food here a can't miss.

t6DehCqa6jegxCxg2rp_XA.text: Food is very very bold here with lots of distinct flavors. Was recommended by the dudes behind the counter to go with the bowl. Comes with rice, 1 meat, 1 veggie, 1 salad and as many fix-in toppings your heart desires. Cucumbers, feta cheese, pickled radishes, and tzatziki sauce. On the side was warm pita bread. Also took advantage of the yelp check in for a free tea.   The only thing that bothered me was the temperature inside of the restaurant. It was so warm that I felt like I had just entered a sauna. We had no choose but to order to-go.

qNZBHKn4LDLDzedBwKilvQ.text: The food is very good to the point of being unique.    You can get most of what is served here elsewhere, if you stop at several different restaurants, but I think you'd be hard pressed to find a single place that does what Hummus Xpress does.  This is the third or fourth time I've been here but  it occurred to me today that if you're one of those people who doesn't like their food touching this might not be the place for you since everything kind of goes into one big pile.  Frankly it makes for some very interesting flavors, but it may not be for everyone.

ui15bgCZeEGJEkgZkaTIoQ.text: We picked this place based on yelp reviews.  Thanks!! This is now our "go to" for gyros. This place offers a nice amount of toppings, awesome make your own pita/plate/bowl.  Please give this local business a shot.

UL8k7kk6uosPdFpmOCufWw.text: The only problem I have is that there aren't more locations.  Stumbled across this place during my work lunch break... Holy wow.  Pick a style, pick a meat, pick a veggie, pick a salad/bean, pick your hummus, pick your toppings, pick your sauce

pr63ojiMRw-nd1rPuD4-Ag.text: Outstanding food! Gary (one part of my Dining Trio) and I were hungry after attending a conference. We were cruising by the choices on Broadway and saw "HUMMUS" on the strip mall store. That made me curious. So, we adventured into the restaurant to give it a try. Very worthwhile!  Whether you are a vegan, vegetarian or meat eater, you will find something you love here. The staff was very engaging, friendly and helpful. It took a few minutes to wrap our heads around how the choices work. You can engineer your own great meal, picking and choosing by sight what you want.  One thing: if you like falafel, try it here! It was some of the best. And I used to eat it when I traveled in the Middle East. Gary and I shared the largest plate and had a blast trying this and that, and adding this topping and that topping. The eggplant was pretty darn yummy, too.  Go in with a sense of adventure, and try the offerings. Try new tastes and open up your world to new flavors and textures. This type of food is very healthy. It was a fun dining experience and I wish Hummus were in Tucson. I'd be a regular!

5mO1BXKHGP3PVNGqUE4nIw.text: I love that place. Created my own bowl with rice, gyro, carrots, lentil salad and many other delicious ingredients. Awesome food! Everything is fresh and tastes good. And the owners are very friendly.

ruOmIrC8EiyWLHuOSqkDnw.text: Food was very good but wish they would put bigger scoops in  the plates, they we're stingy with it.

SrdB8HwRWNhg_7LvS2xkLA.text: Drove by this place & made a note to check it out.  Stopped to see what everyone on Yelp thought and that sealed the deal.    So many options, endless combinations, and a very friendly staff.  The food was delicious and I will definitely be heading back to sample some more.  What a bargain.  I opted for the "plate" which comes with 2 proteins, 2 veggies, 1 salad, toppers, and a sauce, oh! and hummus.  I wound up with chicken, beef, roasted veggies, the kale, chopped salad, hummus, olives, pickles, pita, garlic aioli, and a pita for under $10!

N3aDJeNjZYuJE8GvSy8KTQ.text: This is my favorite place to eat for lunch - I have an honest belief it will be the 'Chipotle' of fantastically delicious, reasonably priced, Mediterranean/Middle-East inspired cuisine within the next 5 to 10 years!  Everything tastes super fresh (try the garlic aioli!!), is incredibly filling (portions are spot-on), and did I mention it's easily less than $9 a person???  Make sure you tip well!

rZf36cAmlisN9cAK1tTa_Q.text: I think we have an up and coming Yelp favorite everyone! They have only been open a short time but the quality of the food is quite good. They have it set up so that one  goes through it in sort of an operational line, picking the items one wants in the pita, bowl or the dinner plate size, and the food is basically Lebanese.   The seasoned rice (yes, I forgot what it is called) is amazing and for vegetarians there is a bevy of no-meat options. I did try the gyros meet with the dinner size option but the grilled eggplant is also quite good. They also have a seasonal veggie option and the day I went it was rainbow kale - kale, how cool is that one folks!  I plan to go back and update my review after a few times but right now I would say this is a culinary gem located, as Juan B notes, in a strip mall, but that is sometimes where you find the best eating experiences, right? Looks like, based on Kory L's review, that I will have to try the falafel next time, sounds delicious! :-)

qiLE2emoJQmItQ4isBx4vw.text: Love love love this place! A little diamond in the ruff! :-) excellent every time & reasonably priced!

h5Lsq9Obno5rE2Lt4BsIFg.text: We got two bowls for delivery.  They both had chicken broccoli rice beans and hummus . I didnt really enjoy the food that much I felt the chicken was extremely dry and the brocolli was really hard almost not cooked.

jfgchGHYuhHIOiL-tIt5Dw.text: The quality of food here is about as good as it gets for quick dining. This is Chipotle-style for Mediterranean food. There are many options, so I recommend reviewing the website before going in, because the staff expects you to move along quickly.  I ordered a bowl with rice, gyro meat, fried eggplant, potatoes, jalapeno hummus, tabouli salad, cucumber, tomatoes and Tzatziki sauce. It sounds like an unusual mix, but it works, and the portions are good for the price. I was happy with everything in my bowl. My brother recommended trying the chicken and chipotle hummus the next time we eat there.   There is not much seating inside the restaurant, so you may have to order to-go during the lunch hour.

CO5JZ9x6uz_Rc92aOah2cQ.text: Went strictly off of all of the amazing Yelp reviews and could not have been less impressed. The location is small and dark but somewhat eclectic if that is your kind of thing. The food was okay at best. The Hummus was way too runny and the pita bread was horrible and cold to boot. The only reason I did not give them a lower rating is because the service was really good. Lastly the pricing was quite high, over $27 for two people.

2o0CuwPRUH_Bxlmk_1l2Jw.text: weird service but awesome food ! i got a chicken platter and the food was delicious and priced reasonably.

rSGXIJViLzWHWWYYkORqww.text: First time here got a bowl.  Found 3 bay leaves 3 so far. Aren't those removed before serving?  Beef tasted dried out.  Really disappointed with the oddly flavored food that I just paid $9 to feed the landfill.

PN8-jJys_3NWGJKiIKPYhQ.text: Their food truck came to my office complex yesterday for the first time so I decided to give them a try. I ordered the gyro bowl but am trying to do low carb right now so I got it without the rice. To my surprise it also came with a piece of pita bread. Well of course I ate that because I am not going to say no to pita if it is right in front of me. Overall the meat and veggies tasted great; I really loved that each had it's own unique flavoring. I ordered the eggplant and carrots for my two veggie options but he offered to give me a third since they were hardly any carrots left so I also got kale. Unfortunately the kale was a bit watery, even though it tasted amazing, and so that sort of diluted the hummus. So the consistency was a bit off but the red pepper hummus was still delicious. I really enjoyed my meal and I hope that the truck comes back again.

r7-Z0yAg2hui_T-ciJelfg.text: This is definitely one of my favorite places to grab a hummus bowl the food is delicious and the staff is really helpful and friendly highly recommend my only complain is I wish they were down the street from me!

Gl724foMNEoNC0-suG5Xjg.text: Excellent Hummus, lots of options to make your bowl, plate or salad. I love this place

iOaeou1MPA5yPl2iQ68mzA.text: The food is delicious! And who doesn't want to support local businesses? My issues lie in the cleanliness of food handling. Handling food with bandages on hands and no gloves, sleeveless shirts in the kitchen... things like that. Again, the food is fantastic! I also wish that the baskets the food are served in were larger, because the food portion you receive is a healthy portion and it's such a small basket to try to eat out of. I will continue to return. But I wish the food handling was taken a bit more seriously.

6xzjtqYjeILY3rWf5QHnsw.text: Service was outstanding and the food was fresh and tasty. We shared a hummus plate with chicken on it. Loved the ability to add my favorite veggies. The jalapeno cilantro hummus has a delicious kick to it! The regular hummus with garlic was good too. It was so good, we ordered The roasted red pepper  hummus to take home for game day tomorrow. YUM  I really wish there was one in Gilbert, I would be a regular!!

Zn-lQq_kpVMjjWjfgi5SJQ.text: Mediterranean food is almost binary. Its either great or its terrible. After having had some really amazing experiences at other places, it feels a little harsh to dig into Hummus express, but there's so many ways that it felt uninspiring. Its definitely got potential, but it falls short in too many places. The customer service is good, and they have some good toppings and sauces, but you're limited to just 1 sauce. The meat is hit or miss depending on what you get.  If I'm getting a platter/plate, I safely assume that the rice that is served should be decent. How a Mediterranean food restaurant fails to execute rice is beyond my belief. At 6 pm, you can't blame the lack of customers for rice that seemed not only stale but completely overcooked. It looked like couscous, but tasted mushy like mashed potatoes. The chicken was decent, and the gyro actually had great taste and texture. However, the braised beef reminded me of a bland pot roast that was undercooked leaving it tough and chewy. I thought it was peculiar this was even an item at this place, but I would definitely stay away from that one.   There's plenty of fresh, high-quality toppings to choose from, but they are a little stingy with them. You get a very small pinch of each thing making it similar to a sampler. The eggplant tastes great and was one of the few toppings they didn't hold back on. Meanwhile though, the sauces were plagued by the same thing exhibited by the toppings. I don't quite understand why you're limited to one sauce when most other places let you try as many as you want, within reason of course.  At the moment, I can't really recommend this place. Its good, but has far too many holes to patch up. The service is excellent, and I'm sure they'll turn it around. I just don't think it fits my tastes.

7kwQm5ORL4eXgFs_GhRJLg.text: I can not get over this place. The food was amazing, the service was amazing, oh and did I mention that the food was out if this world?  Honestly was not expecting much, my boyfriend and I were hungry and wanted to try something healthier... So we went in, split a plate and a hummus bowl, and had left overs. The food was so good, we are going back again tomorrow for more. I have a feeling I will be a regular. ;)

OyQkncCs3MNEith6CyA57A.text: I recommend hummus xpress to everyone who likes good Mediterranean food! The combo choices offer anything you can think of- a great selection of meats, hot and cold veg, hummus, and sauces. My boyfriend and I got to sample ALL of the hummus options and it was so hard to pick which was best because they were ALL unique and delicious! I got the "bowl" which is the smallest of the combo meals, but it was very filling and satisfying AND I have leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Finally, the service was tremendous! The gentlemen serving the food were very knowledgable and were eager to give recommendations :)

q9rVGMQisxhrzHsGUgHxJg.text: A great restaurant hidden in Tempe.  I am a big fan of Mediterranean  cuisine so I am quite happy that I finally decided to check this place out. I ordered a bowl and had more than enough food, especially for under $10. The woman helping me was quite friendly and even more so once she found out that it was my first time in. I went with most of her recommendations (aleppo beef, jalapeno/cilantro hummus, cauliflower, etc.) and for the most part it was delicious. The piping hot pita bread (choice of regular or whole wheat) was awesome too!   My only complaint was that the beef seemed to be mostly fat, although it was seasoned nicely. Maybe I'll try the chicken or gyro meat next time.  Planning to return very regularly!

I1SJ7tJPMcd8oaZg4qkF1w.text: One the best lunch hangouts! Relatively inexpensive, great tasting meditterean cuisine. Fast and friendly service. Can't go wrong!

FEe3wgedMm8og1fESgyL3Q.text: Good, decent, fast Mediterranean food. You can mix and match your plate or bowl with many different types of meats, hummus, and salad.  Good for on the go if you're craving Mediterranean food. Mind you that if they have a slow day, it may be sitting for a few in the warmers so you won't get that freshly cooked meat that you would get a sit down restaurant.   Staff is very nice.

znlEfUVtp0JbhSpUojq9dg.text: Been eating here for a year or so. Consistently awesome. Fresh, healthy, delicious, and excellent value. Perfect quick lunch spot in Tempe. Wish they had the beet hummus all the time but they only use ingredients in season, which speaks to how great they are. When choosing amongst veggies, the eggplant is to die for. Can't go wrong with any of the protein options. Bravo Hummus Xpress.

2NUTnxpZ7skovd9SD4PNag.text: The concept of this restaurant is comparable to Chipotle. You pick pita, bowl or plate, then you pick what goes inside. I was really confused at first becasue the order of the menu on the wall was from right to left and not left to right. I wonder why... The gal behind the counter realized quickly that we were new and started explaining the menu. I picked the pita option and some random ingredients I thought they would taste good together. The whole thing turned out amazing. You can ask for sauces and rice on the side. A bonus to this place is the free iced tea check in offer. They had 3 very refreshing flavors: green, peach lavender, and mango. I took a cup to go and sipped on it for the rest of the day.

AqtiMWoZXbs8tjtAdbUoBQ.text: I got a bowl. There is a good variety of options for meat and vegetarian entrees. Flavor for saffron rice, tabouleh, and gyro good. The texture to the gyro meat was a bit mushy, like it had been sitting the steamer bin for a long time. The grilled eggplant was more on the burnt than grilled. Classic hummus was spot on, good. My visit was at a little after 130pm.   The foil bowl is deceiving in how filling it is. Filled with a meat or veggie entree, rice, salad, veggie side, hummus and a pita!  Would be willing to go back, try some other options like falafel and the lentil salad.  Service was nice. She asked if I had ever been there before. And since it was my first time she walked me through ordering.

lii3nTvWIcVHWi1q_BLouw.text: I have been wanting to try this place for months, and finally tried it today. I grabbed takeout for lunch, I was in and out in under  five minutes. All the food is labeled clearly "gluten free" or "vegan" which was really cool. Everything tasted delicious and fresh, I really enjoyed my bowl( chicken, zucchini, jalapeno hummus, rice, lentil-kale salad, with bunch of different veggie toppings). Staff was friendly to me (and my daughter who was making faces at them the whole time lol) over all great experience, will be back soon.

RggSod_F87qlF9J0f2_h7A.text: Close to the office and way better food than a drive-thru.  First time there today and I was warmly greeted and guided through my choices.  I got a bowl with rice, broccoli, chicken, classic hummus, tabouli and some tzatziki, with a wheat pita.  Plenty of food.  Price was fair.  I'm adding it to my Go To places for lunch.

cHJxXwJpnRaXBq2oDPL_hg.text: Everything I had here was great! The vegan options are clearly marked and they give you a lot of food for the money. If the sign says spicy believe it!

XUgXayhnZGK-elmGjJEAeA.text: Me and my boyfriend are avid hummus fans and have thus made it our mission to try hummus at every restaurant we can. This place is freaking amazing. Everything is delicious and full of flavor.   Now, this place definitely has some inefficiency issues, especially when it comes to making the pita. There point of sale system is also kind of slow (and I have my suspicious about the staff).  This can be upsetting when getting to-go orders as it effects the temperature of the food. But this is my only complaint and will certainly not keep me from coming here.   Their set up is that of a chipotle style, they press the pita at the beginning (or at least that is the intention, if you get something with pita on the side, they wait until the end which slows down the process) and you pick your sides, meat, hummus and toppings. Everything ends up being kinda mixed together but is still good. I even liked the rice, which I don't typically like but I'm having suspicions that I just inherently like Mediterranean style rice.   *Gyro meat- great Falafel - pretty good  *potatoes - fantastic *Jalapeno/Cilantro hummus - amazeballs, very spicy *Classic hummus - Great ( I like it topped with onion, pickles and tomatoes) Rice - delicious Lemon-garlic hummus - a little spicy but pretty good chipotle hummus- pretty good *chili .. something sauce - spicy and delicious tzaiki - great  *favorite items  ***forgive spelling, since I'm writing this review in lieu of doing my homework, I'm not gonna take the extra time to look them up

wmhJ6rHRRMQYi_mDrHtzmg.text: It's hard to add much more than what is already written for this restaurant, which properly backs up the high 4+ star rating (as of this review).   The owner/chef definitely cares about his food, the quality is high, the recipes amazing (the best roasted eggplant I had ever had) and the food a darn good value.     Although I won't deduct any stars because from a food standpoint it was so good, I would suggest the following:  1.  Great concept - and well explained on the website, but the limited chalkboard menu above the food line doesn't make it abundantly clear what your options are (such as an extra veggie costing more - and if so, how much?  2.  Consider a side of hummous w/out the meat/fill-in or falaffel.  Maybe a small side to accompany a pita for 2 bucks or so.  The regular hummous I tried was amazing.  I'd gladly order a pita and then add a side to that order.  3.  Expand to the west side!  This is a great restaurant and concept - I passed by as I work not too far, but won't forever.  I will definitely miss this place when that day comes.

LjJ4i6tX89gRQaSGtKrb2w.text: Hummus Express has the feel of a neighborhood cafe with more authentic fare. I come here on about a weekly basis. By far the best gyro meat I've ever had. Apparently, the trick is to marinate. I usually get a bowl, which seems quite reasonable price-wise given the amount of food. I am also quite fond of the grilled eggplant.

KUQL5RZPtOLr3oFpuqTtgw.text: The Veggie Bowl is the way to go. But the Gyro is delicious also. I have been here a handful of times and I'm always happy with my choices. The service is outstanding, the food is fresh and the prices are amazing! Don't miss this place. It's worth the stop.

8Ge9xMD2SRE9dmfDpC6nmA.text: First experience yesterday! It was AMAZING. Employee was extremely nice and helpful. He walked me through how this place works and described what everything in the window was. I've heard good things which is why I walked in, but I was more impressed. So so good!!!!

JZPqVNmvdluzaB2_J6wYFg.text: I am obsessed with this place!! As a vegetarian it's hard to find convenient options that don't lack in flavor. They never disappoint and I love that they are always changing it up with new items. They are so many flavors and combinations to try, doesn't get boring.

u2eFsOhSDmvDIm_uErXZgg.text: The Chipotle of the Mediterranean. Fresh, flavorful and fast. The tea tasted like it was actually brewed in the back, not from a mix. I hadn't ever been here before, but if I lived or worked in this area I'd be a regular.  The menu was a bit confusing but essentially you choose a meat, rice, hummus and other toppings. The Yelp check in bonus was a free iced tea. The serving sizes were generous enough that I couldn't finish it all for lunch, and all of the flavors went together really well. Plenty of vegetarian and low carb options since you could trade something out for the meat or rice portions of the dish.  Staff was friendly and helpful even with a busy lunchtime crowd. I needed sugar for my tea since there wasn't any at the beverage station and someone ran into the back to get me some. Unfortunately, he came back with salt, which I dumped in and then nearly gagged at. Second time was the charm though, and the tea was great.

BqT7H-EEVnGaN7208_hoKg.text: Sigh. I wanted to love this place. I wanted it to be my little Mediterranean heaven. Alas, too damn salty! I couldn't eat my food, I had to keep diluting it with sour cream, which usually won't be problematic but it didn't help. I honestly don't know if I will return...maybe once my sodium returns to a normal level.

iOp_z_hP-GgrU-2xLrKoaQ.text: Delicious. Fresh. Huge portions...you could probably split with someone.   Good stuff.

bsZv5GkzEldIUWqIP34RIw.text: It was okay, I got a chicken bowl w/ rice and various vegges and toppings. Everything seemed kind of old, like it was sitting out for a while. The flavors were nothing amazing. Not exactly sure how this place has 4.5 stars..

uAsE39XN0eiMbRl1Ib2C-w.text: Amazing food! Great portion size with reasonable prices as well! Was my first time and the employee was very helpful and friendly in guiding me through the "build your own" process. Will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hummus bound with meat. Jalapeño cilantro &amp; red pepper hummus base, chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, red bell peppers, ginger carrots

UfwsC-5AadMileutVqPzig.text: Ok, so I don't like fast food places, nor places that is fast food places but pretend not to be fast food places. Hummus express is a fast food place.. but not only do I like the food, I love the concept and the attitude of the employees.   So I was going to a barbecue and wanted to bring some hummus. Now, I could have made it myself - but mine isn't as experimentally fantastic as what they make here. Ginger-Lemon Hummus sounds wacky, but it is so obscenely divine that one needs to test it. And talking about faith in your product when you can sample everything before you buy it.   So I bought some hummus... only the hummus, even if the guys behind the counter told me how I could walk out with more stuff for less money if I followed their lead - but I didn't have to. Instead they gave me hummus, and I paid. WIn-WIn.  I wish there was a way I could convey how awesome i believe this place to be - it will not suit everyone, but give it a shot. Give it a lunch.. its like $6. You could get hooked like me, or you could let the world know that you are not a connoisseur of fine experimental food, but a boring old meanie-face that smells of Chicken McNuggets.  If you do take my advice, drop my name.. and they will have absolutely no idea who I am ;)   - A 6th star for the attitude of the employees.

OGjU4Ft9A61vHEiGS7em5g.text: They were welcoming and patient with us even when they were about to close in 15 minutes. They gave us samples of all the different options, and even heated up a falafel for us to try.   Even though they were about to close, they let us eat inside anyways. Super nice of them, thank you!   The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable in their food.   All the flavors are vey strong and bold. If you get the bowl, try everything separately before mixing it all together. The cilantro jalapeno hummus has a nice bite, and the chipotle hummus is great as well.  Overall, the food was very tasty and the prices were very affordable for the quality and amount of food given. Definitely worth a try!

FmyWo5w7CewRuANHwgA5Cg.text: Good mediterranean bowls, created in front of you while tell the cook what to use.

9s0OSNAQw-ktj4XCWJ1dVg.text: Great food, simple setup, I love this place!  I discovered this place based on Yelp reviews less than 2 weeks ago, and I've already made it there a total of 3 times. This place is that good! Although I don't really care for the comparison to Chipotle in any way, they themselves describe themselves as being like Chipotle in that you get up in the line and pick out items along the way (i.e., meat, salad, veggies, etc.). There are enough choices here that the variety is practically endless.  So far, I've gotten the bowl 3 times. I've had chicken every time (I'll change that at some point). I've tried the broccoli, carrots (fantastic!), and kale--all are good. I've tried 3 of the types of hummus--cilantro jalapeno, red pepper, and one other that I can't remember right now--again, they're all excellent, and I look forward to trying the other 3. There is a variety of veggies you can put on top. Everything is fresh, and the jalapenos are always spicy. There are 5 different sauces, and the ones I've tried so far are delicious. Finally, the bowl comes with rice and a pita (white or wheat) if you so choose.  There are also pita, salad, and plate options, but the bowl has worked out so well so far that I haven't felt the need to try anything else. Along with one of the empanadas they've had available (spinach or cheese), I've had plenty of food every time I've gone.  This place really is great. I'll be a regular here.

mCgyOuo8rJyQOW68UQWx0A.text: A little expensive for the food and it seemed like the food has been sitting out there for quite a while. The vegetables were soggy and very salty especially the eggplant. The hummus selection was good though.

fykp69Mv7zlth8j98qtcsw.text: Wow, just wow.  I came here not really knowing what to expect.  I tried it for the first time today and I already can't wait to go back.    The layout is much like Chipotle.  The two dudes that were working were super nice and super helpful.  It was my first time so they let me try a couple things and gave me advice on what was best.  Ready for this: I ended up getting a bowl with rice, fried eggplant, some sort of broccoli, chicken, lentil kale salad, red onion, tomato, a little bit of tzatziki and jalapeno cilantro hummus.  With a wheat pita on the side.  It was nothing like I expected but oh my god it was absolutely amazing.  All of the flavors just meshed together.  You taste a little bit of everything, but it's almost like you don't taste anything separate.  You just taste one big bowl of all these different flavors formed into one.  Words really don't do this place justice.     The one thing I will say is don't be scared to do something a little out of your comfort zone.  I told them I don't like eggplant, they had me try it and it was the best eggplant I've ever had.  Some of the stuff they have there might seem a little out there, especially for someone like me who has a very American pallet.  Don't let that scare you and trust the people that work there.  If you aren't afraid of something a little exotic, you HAVE to go here.  If you are a little afraid of exotic, you HAVE to go here.    This is one of those places where you just can't go wrong.

7Ilxi37P9lEpBLPNy7K3Hg.text: It's always fun to find a great little restaurant that serves excellent healthy food choices where the portion sizes are just right.  The protein and vegetable choices that accompany the hummus are all delicious.  The wait time on the food preparation is very short and I was able to eat here and be back to work in an hour without feeling rushed.  The price and the quality of food make this restaurant one of the best finds I have come across in the Tempe area.    Will return (often) and would recommend to family and friends!

rjF9eI1DDrXgw-4WT2ncbQ.text: Awesome food and staff. The menu is fresh and novel. Want to taste something? Just ask. Want to have them customize something? Just ask. This place is the best.

vFwY6xo2GjD8zrgsbNNSCQ.text: This place is AWESOME!!! every time I've been here, I've been super impressed with the quality, freshness, and friendliness as well. You can tell they really do care about the product they serve, which I can definitely respect.   Each time, I've mixed it up a bit with the meat, toppings and different varieties of hummus and have never been let down. Definitely a great concept, with bold flavors and Mediterranean cuisine that I could quite honestly eat every single day. delicious time and time again... you should go and introduce everyone to this hidden gem!

p1XhTKxHTL43RtF5FJaCTw.text: Stopped in today for the first time.  Great Food. Great service. You can custom design your meal, which I love. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and you can tell that they take pride in their work. I will be back and I will also send others here, especially vegans and vegetarians! Thank you for providing a much needed service to all. Good, fresh food!

eZfPfx3yYfBLDs_NvAqe7w.text: Their food is packed with flavor.  A little too much for me to be honest but I still really enjoyed coming here.  The fellas behind the counter were very nice.  Awesome ingredients to choose from.  It' cool how you can pick and choose what you want in your bowl  If we are in the area we would definitely come back again!

gt8E22ze-4wG9qZtNU2P7Q.text: After we're welconed by a very friendly host we were served two tasty bowls with gyro meat.  I ventured through all the toppings and tried every single one :) So fresh and healthy I would highly recommend this place for heath focused foodies :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Max the man, providing great service and food :)
Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Toppings

dhSIUYo7MdgFiJrC7WoSUA.text: Wow! This place has PER-SON-NAL-I-TY!  The guys that cook, serve and own this place are REALLY nice guys, and the food is VERY authentic.  For people who have a 100% Americanized palate, it might be a tad different for your tastes, but if you like meat, no meat, hummus, no hummus, tzatziki (sp?), or veggies, you should definitely stop by.    To be honest, the food is really great, but it's the personalities of the people that work there that will keep me coming back.  I KNOW that I will leave in a good mood after having lunch there. :)

kxBtEaoGzd3JpTGtveN6kA.text: Finally someone is keeping it real in Tempe! I love what this guy is doing! If you are in the area you should go here!!!! Average price for lunch and it only takes a second to get your food.

rY1UxzY6A6lVZynXLkEFBg.text: Yeah 5 stars.       The staff is beyond friendly and the bold flavors are a big refreshing change from the typical sandwich lunch.       Their menu confused me a little,  it works right-to-left because their serving counter works right-to-left and I wasn't quite sure how to order..   next time will be easier now that I know how it works.   Good for vegans and meat eaters,  they have plenty for both.

ox7tziCuzG7R-Ig2sSwdPA.text: For Mediterranean-style food this place is awesome! They have a huge variety of food and it all tastes really good. The flavors are perfect and when you get a plate, it will be more than enough food for anyone.

j4yHS4gw1eMiPIpeiG7nrw.text: When I say this is the best expression of a love for food I've ever experienced! I've had falafels and baklavas at numerous restaurants, festivals and places and I've never- NEVER- had anything CLOSE to the ones I've had here! A falafel full of flavor and the perfect amount to moisture and crunch that just takes you to another place in time. A baklava bar that when you bite into it, the buttery flakes fall perfectly into your mouth as you bite cleanly through each honey and pistachio flavored layer. Not one flavor over powered the other but married and became one to give the most decadent experience. I've never had a good falafel nor baklava except here! Truly amazing food from the hummus to the pita.   I can't even explain about the flavor and quality of everything else. If you want healthier, delicious food, this is it! This is it! Best place hands down!

9K3FAvlvtj0PgyL2yIFhlg.text: I have eaten here 3 times now. It makes for a pretty easy healthy lunch and I like how they are open at 10:30. Chicken and hot veggies are very good. The carrots and brocolli are some of my favorites.  Now, the store bought pita bread is tougher than most and is just ok. I have gotten better pita bread at Costco. Hummus needs more flavor and it's super thin! I think they are watering it down to make it last longer. Tzatziki sauce is ok, but pretty watered down as well. M8YcncPWZ2cmgtwzCIhHHA.text: This was one of the few Mediterranean restaurants that actually tasted authentic and home made. I will be making my way back to this spot when I'm in this city. The veggie options are great and taste amazing. Two thumbs up to this restaurant.

7DlmcIKxsabXPyOZbpJWCw.text: What can I say about this place? It's awesome, delicious, such a great spot.  The only sort of complaint is that their brewed ice tea is often moldy. If this issue was addressed this place would be perfect to me :-)

Kkuuj0RcGN6nWsYzIzQTpA.text: **Vegetarian Friendly**  This place is a Mediterranean version of Chipotle! There are so many flavors and options to choose from that I was overwhelmed! I went based off the team's recommendations and didn't regret any option. The eggplant was my favorite. The hummus is made fresh and you can taste the difference compared to store bought brands. Each bowl comes with a pita on the side for free!  TIP: Can't pick which hummus to add? You can do half and half for no charge!

FBVFgkdZ6mdrtDph0H3jlQ.text: We love this place! Their good is great, the portions are just right and it's always fast, even if there is a line. It is very easy to eat there as a vegan as well, as it's all marked and most of the options are vegan to begin with.  My only complaint is that they are closed on Sunday!  That's the weekend and it's when we have more time to do fun things and eat great food!

I09f7UOS13NYKnGDKmgsYw.text: On the regular lunch rotation, I love this place.  When you need a healthy, fulfilling meal, and on a budget?  This is the place.  The price and the amount of food you get is a super deal.  Beats the big business burrito places and even the smaller gyro stops.    I always get a pita with no rice.  It doesn't matter the hummus and veggie selection as they are all freshly made.  Tabouli is the salad of choice but I have tried the Mediterranean salad and I was impressed.  Unlimited toppings smothered with your choice of sauce.  I go with the Tzatziki but you had me at unlimited toppings.  Like I said, need a fulfilling meal but not that unhealthy stuff?  Go here!!!  On a budget and willing to try something new?  Go here!!!  I have...multiple times.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wheat pita, jalapeño cilantro hummus, Moroccan Shakshuka for veggie, Tabouli, greens for toppings, and Tzatziki.  $6.95?  What a bargain.

qTwZngSpSzQlIK6htauxjw.text: Design your own meal! I love it. Hummus Xpress offers fast, fresh options that are a lot healthier than what you'd normally consider as "fast food." You start with your choice of wrapping or container such as pita, bowl, or plate. You get seasoned rice automatically with your order, and can then choose your meaty protein, falafel, or go veg where you can double up on each section. There are various delicious vegetables to choose from, several hummus flavors, salads, and a last section of condiments and sauce to finish your creation.  I opted for a vegetarian bowl with grilled eggplant, ginger carrots, beet and classic hummus, lentil salad, white bean salad, marinated onion with carrot, chickpeas, and garlic aioli to top it off. Quite a lot of food for a bowl! Each component was full flavored and went well with each other. My favorites of the bowl were the ginger carrots, eggplant, and beet hummus. As a side note, be aware that the garlic aioli is delicious but is made with raw garlic so you will have stinky dragonfire breath if you get it :).  Service was very friendly and cheerful. The space is small so it might be cramped if you go with a large group.   Overall I love the concept and the food is fresh, fast, and flavorful. I'll definitely be back again!

_lid6xL04H70_4w0n_-G4w.text: This place impressed me so much, that it inspired me to write my first Yelp review.   I work about half a mile away from this place, and noticed it was newish driving by. For about 2 months, I intended to try it. Today, I finally took the plunge and walked in not knowing what to expect.   The place is small, and there were only about 4 people sitting at tables, even though there were 3 people working behind the counter. The place is set up kinda like a Chipotle or a Qdoba - you pick the type of meal you want, and right in front of you are all the different options to include.   I choose a bowl and filled it with both types of rice, chicken, grilled eggplant, red pepper hummus, lettuce, tomatoes, green onions, and feta. It also came with my choice of a regular pita or a whole wheat pita. Everything looked amazing! Upon my first bites I discovered it TASTED amazing. Everything was good on it's own, and it was every better when I started mixing it all together. I devoured the whole thing. It is very easy to eat healthy here, since everything is so fresh and so tasty.   I strongly urge everyone to try this place -- they need to stay open so I can solidify it as my regular lunch spot.   The customer service was superb too -- they explained to me how the meals worked and even let me try the hummus since I must have looked distraught over having too many options.   My bowl and my pita rang in for less than $8. Fantastic!

nSG0JWO7mTMBm0GpxJ-Yxg.text: I would say the good is pretty alright here. There were a lot of bold flavors that I don't think I was ready for, but it was good nonetheless. Right when we got there, the two men behind the counter were very nice and welcoming. The heat though, was not welcoming. We chose to get our food to go because there was no way we could sit in that room to enjoy our meal.  Anyways, the guys made our meal easy to choose from all the choices and were very helpful as we were first timers. If you can, get the tea. I think I enjoyed that more than the actual meal. Great service, and I can see good for others, just not my thing I don't think.

SwHKv8zTBwSk42Shf6qrwQ.text: The food here is great, I've never had a problem with any of the staff and they are super helpful. As a vegan/vegetarian they know which of the their product fits my diet. My only gripe is that they need bigger water cups, but that won't stop me from coming. Keep up the good work Hummus Xpress!

KIKjkOqWpGdivF7qZG_h9A.text: I finally had the chance to make it over here after having this place bookmarked for like 5 months now. osayeu3gTe1uFycvxVzFIQ.text: Yummy food! Tried the Gyro plate with rice. Reminds me of a chipotle as they had a counter you order to chose what you want it in. Everything had so much flavor. svDVCjLm6YrNF7nbYnveWQ.text: Just had lunch there and I was really excited about having a new lunch option....then I went to the bathroom and a cook came out and did not wash his hands...I will not be returning.

L7sb27XoUaUdWyrYHEmdFQ.text: This is probably one of the weirder reviews I'll ever write. When I rate something 5 stars, not only does the food have to be hallucination-inducing, uncontrollably drooling awesome, but so does the service itself. In this case, the service pretty much is non-existent and confusing to the core but they have me whipped, chained, and weak at the knees for their food.   Eddie owns the place and he's pretty awesome at what he does. The flavors are so intense and so on point but not only that, they're kind of visually stunning as well. Be mesmerized by how intensely pink the beet hummus is or be nervous when you see how many fresh green jalapeno specks there are in the cilantro hummus. Their rice is a beautiful saffron golden color and always fluffy like a pillow. Their meats, especially their lamb and beef ... would you like some meat with your steamy meat juices? Because that's how succulent they are. Everything is just an explosion of flavor because of how many herbs and spices they use in each dish. I will warn you that by eating their potatoes, you should plan on not speaking to anyone for the next 8 hours because it is just deliciously bombarded with an obnoxious amount of garlic.   I order catering all the time for my workplace and the moment the work floor get an email that there's Hummus Xpress - they drop everything for it. These full grown men are willing to sit still through a 45-minute vendor presentation that probably doesn't even relate to what they do just to be able to enjoy the food rather than go out for lunch themselves. In our world, that's some major dedication.   Service? Let's just say it's been a trip. Sometimes when I call to order, their phone line doesn't work and they just don't fix it - just because. So then you're stuck for 3 months having to resort to ordering something else while you live on edge that your insatiable coworkers might jump you. Finally get a hold of them? Kitchen fire - closed. Need a catering order? E-mail it and hope that they show up at the time you requested because they never responded or asked for payment. Get the receipt - not even sure what they charged you for but it looks about right because you're too busy already stuffing your face. I'm sure it's different when you're there in person, but no matter how many obstacles they throw my way to make it seem like they don't want my business at all, I still keep vying for their attention like some crazy pre-teen Justin Bieber fan.

OTQyW4qtYAZxnXvyPMkgqw.text: Hummus Xpress catered a friends birthday party and w/in two days, we are on site.   I am impressed by their build your own Mediterranean cuisine concept. The food is delicious, as if cooked fresh rather than under a hot plate on a line.   The employees were really accommodating and satisfied our hungry and indecisive tummies.  And whoa nelly ... they aren't kidding when they say spicy ... My flavor buds are still salivating at the fresh flavors!  Now if only they had a location closer to Scottsdale (hint hint)

OhSes6ZETqorPfsMSKhz_g.text: Pretty bomb!! Total dive in a marginal area.  It's basically a Subway but Mediterranean style food and you make it into the bowl you want. It's solid. dV39gof3fmn8kS9eaGkCNg.text: This place is unique. Its a chipotle style restaurant gone Mediterranean style. I ended up getting the salad with gyro meat and loaded it with all the toppings and some zucchini with jalapeno hummus and dressing on the side. It is a big salad and it left me full for hours after. I highly recommend this place as a place to get a quick bite or for them to help you with your catering needs.
