zwTSSggpJzov4u4QZg8CTg.text: this review is specifically for the "fresh squeezed" lemonade. it is fresh squeezed, however, that is the squeeze of a lemon juice bottle. it was so gross. I went up to purchase a soda to replace it, told the cashier about it and was not offered a replacement. oh well. the sweet potatoe hummus was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

IdLWfSzVCWGHL2i63yLhDA.text: The place had a nice feel to it, easy, the staff was friendly and helpful with everyone.  When I arrived there was no line but they were able to keep up with demand as the lunch rush progressed. The place filled up with people pretty quickly after I arrived. The food was very tasty. I had the salad with gyro meat, grilled veggies and hummus. All very good, would have been nice to have a 2nd pita bread, but that's just because it was so good, I had the wheat pita.

XM0roC0XyuQq601eWwJSVg.text: A coworker suggested we go here and I wanted something hearty so we ended up here. Staff was friendly and the food was amazing. I had the braised beef and chicken plate. The beef was perfect and tasted fantastic. Chicken was fine but I wasn't too thrilled with the flavor of it. The tabouli salad that I picked with the plate was very good and I had the chipotle hummus which was very rich and flavorful. The only thing that I would suggest is that a plate meal should come with two pita instead of just one. I'm from out of state but whenever I'm in the Tempe area, I plan to come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. So much food on the plate meal!

kv0fpaIX4Uw-uwcNCy2ySA.text: I was in the neighborhood looking for a a cheap, quick lunch. Yelp brought me here. I got the falafel bowl . Basically you can just choose what you want and then mix it all up for you. I got falafel with rice, tabouli salad, cilantro hummus and tons of veggies all for less than $8!

1SMDQZz9QVayoVtUAG0H6w.text: Yum. Fast, authentic, healthy and delicious! I will be back, probably tomorrow:) Not to be missed.

B-l-DjPu6ya6mLbtZGoxiA.text: Nothing fancy, just quality food at an affordable price. Hummus for days. Really great service.

NnXLDfxR38hWeTPovYTQMA.text: The flavor and spices are great however it was on food that was sitting for a while.  Healthier options available.  The plate is good if your hungry, has a lot of options.

D25GFaxSaTQY6iwNjdtzdw.text: Amazing food and wonderful service! I wasn't sure how the setup worked but the staff was very friendly, made great recommendations, and they let me sample a few things as well! A bowl has a lot of food- neither my boyfriend nor I could finish it! I love that they offer falafels as a vegetarian option, and the beet hummus is a must try (I don't even like beets). Go here NOW!

phOEBG6rT5ZdNOm-uXEK2Q.text: Mmm! MMM! Love this place and love the concept. The food is fresh, flavorful, and fantastic! I like to get a bowl with rice, gyro meat, glazed carrots, eggplant, tzatziki, and shug with a pita on the side. Your belly will thank you after! The owner/chef puts his passion for food in his choices and you can tell in the service and taste. I hope they open more around the Valley!

eUgn1LpjNsPqWInstBmXng.text: Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Tempe.   From the hummus to the rice everything is packed with flavor.  The owner is also incredibly friendly and the portions are generous.

0jgDlVJ7weAOI9DKmAAA-w.text: Meat was amazing and the concept was different. You should get the plate and have the lamb meat, soooo good.

rfJH-HSi0TTFl5zH8Scgng.text: I love this place! My boyfriend and I come here all the time and the owner always remembers us. The food is amazing with great service and a reasonable price! The falafels are made the order and the lamb melts in your mouth. Amazing Mediterranean food!

oevQvMEyucNCRUxVmYcJMQ.text: After reading the other reviews, I'm pretty much just seconding most of them.  It really is like a Mediterranean Chipotle:  Pick your size, pick your rice, pick your veggies, pick your meat, pick more veggies, pick your hummus, pick your sauce.  It's awesome, very delicious, everything fresh.    Price is "fair".  Not expensive, not cheap.  Just fair.  My meal with a drink is like $10.  The owner/manager was also incredibly helpful in recommendations, descriptions, etc.  Great guy.  Even had a couple of kids playing sax/guitar a few times, if that's your thing.

87IYdflflI6wmzVbJTYsFg.text: Staff was friendly and helpful. Food was delicious and full of delicious flavors! Located in a section of town with so many fast food places, this is a welcome find for a healthy delicious meal!

860VmxMlcSV2KSw1pZNHhQ.text: Numerous great options to choose from! Who knew ginger hummus existed! The staff were cool & super nice to us. I personally  preferred  take out to eating in. I almost wish the location (strip mall) was a little better..like next to a natural foods store instead of a pet store. Loved it nevertheless!

gQ-UAwCQOPGYS7SHvktWBg.text: Delicious! Quick! Easy!  So glad we tried Hummus Xpress.  My chicken pita was great but I didn't expect so many delicious salad and side options too.  Can't wait to come back again and try more

7w0VVysjKUrclmNRLG_4pg.text: Kind of complicated menu but everything was tasty but I bet it could be fresher if there was more business.  Love that it's mostly vegetables! Try the beets and kale salad. This is a great option for a healthy lunch in the area. Music is a bit loud and skip the baklava.

mzPAlisRXp8yB2gtbQsoMw.text: Love everything about this place. Everything is full of flavor and mouthwatering, decently priced and super fast service. Came in lady was very sweet, everyone there is very friendly. I'll will defiantly be coming back here. Hard to find vegan friendly places hummus xpress is a keeper!

dVfrBpiyr4PHq6fnk9hxwA.text: This place is fantastic.  I had their bowl with beef, fried eggplant, saffron rice, classic hummus, and the kale salad.  I work close-by and plan on bringing my co-workers in.  This is definitely on the regular lunch spot rotation.  The peach-lavender tea was also lovely. Everything was very fresh.  Try it out! You won't be disappointed!  :)

zIenpdlxC0PFm6ftR50MHw.text: So delicious! Great for veg and nonveg ppl. The food is actually flavorful and pretty healthy. The service is also amazing really genuine and sincere. Loved it and would recommend it for lunch!

VRiol0eeDqe8_EeUytECqw.text: Looking for Mediterranean in Tempe and stumbled onto Hummus Express. Who needs ambience when the food is this great. Excellent vegetarian and meat choices to please any palate. We'll be back!

7jXujbrMlSzmtcGWloNAIQ.text: Delicious! Lots of healthy options, and I love that I could go here every day and get something totally different. The owners are great too- really friendly, helpful and they listen to your input. When they first opened, they only had bottled teas and fountain soda- I was bummed that I couldn't get brewed iced tea. Now they have unique teas and delicious lemonade as well. Even if you think you don't like Mediterranean food you should try this place- it's great!

xZNePL0ejPMk2ONbxS72UQ.text: Yum!!! This place is awesome. A vegan hidden gem!! Excellent selection of add ons at no additional charge. The guy working there, possibly an owner, was very down to earth, made great suggestions and friendly. Definitely coming here again. The food was AMAZING!!

s3QLTAXAuxWAuAM5KVjHmw.text: Extremely generous quantities of the most delicious vegetables, hummus, meats and other complimentary ingredients. Would recommend asking the owner for guidance on which ingredients taste best together (as you get to select and choose the combination for your meal, and there is a wide variety to choose from).  I ate here with my family and we all were totally impressed by the quality and flavor of the options (and the quantities).  Very reasonably priced, casual small setting, friendly owner.  Definitely give it a try if you have the opportunity.

pcUTGcl5Jyz_wT2i_rmbTg.text: This place is a hidden gem. It offers amazing and authentic food at an affordable price. If you like Mediterranean then hummus express is a must. Everything is always fresh and packs a punch. I have high hopes for this business. It has great potential.

rMYBU2YeOSZWbIAPSBk7uw.text: This is an awesome place. Was visiting the Phoenix area for work and saw the high rating on Yelp so I had to stop in. The food was delicious and fresh, seemed better than the other Mediterranean restaurant we checked out (Pita Jungle). All in all I would come back again.

M1W5BB7PtQJxC4nCYS-yoQ.text: Awesome food!  A great find!  Roll your own plates with fresh, perfectly spiced food.

3QvjMmQ07-UPSLjh0iPFQA.text: I could eat here every day.The freshest most delicious ingredients, and to top it off a wonderful staff! Love everything about this place :)

BFQsJ-kfMZwfOu4ILLEwqg.text: I've always enjoyed going to Hummus Express but have found recently that whenever I go with my girlfriend and I we are treated very rudely by whoever is helping us with our food. My girlfriend went in by herself today and when she got back home she told me she felt awkward there because the guy preparing her food was giving her sexual innuendos and hitting on her while winking multiple times. This is not respectable towards customers at all and it is making me be tentative going back which I will hate because I enjoy the food and have enjoyed the service in the past.

2IorsxBAXagnqfpMuq6Q3A.text: Honestly. Go here if you care about eating great tasting, healthy food and supporting a unique local business. It's like chipotle for Mediterranean food. Delicious.

sci6o2PemburzRuPbycIMw.text: Chipotle meets Pita Jungle... this place is great! Get extra eggplant, it's to die for :)

F1V99_cvuFFYzXpyumWboQ.text: I never post reviews but this place is a small business that deserves a chance at success and growth because their food and service is that good.  I go there for lunch at least one time per week and I have never had a meal less than great and the staff is always noticeably on top of their game.

zL8Z3wvOEuZB6bMy9OZclw.text: I'm so glad I found this restaurant on yelp today.  Amazing food!!!  The other reviewers are right!  You won't be disappointed. :-)

yQKxtkUCc1w1R_vfA8nTPQ.text: SO GOOD! We were offered samples of their hummus so we we could make the right choice. If you're really hungry grab the "Plate" otherwise a "Bowl" will do. Tasty, filling served with a warm wheat or white pita! A must go :)

lw2yDu8LuLjMEDHude9FrQ.text: I have to say that I was taken aback by the freshness and quality of the food here. I was a little nervous about eating at a place in a strip mall, but am very happy that I was convinced to do so. The food was delicious, the staff was very helpful in helping me pick out items, and the portions are extremely generous. The staff described the setup/ordering as "Chipotle, for Mediterranean food". This place kicks that 'C' word restaurant's butt. Cannot wait to return. Rice, veggies, gyro meat, hummus, feta cheese, sauce, and pita were all delicious. I'm salivating while typing this up... sorry keyboard :)

oimeY8-lPXoa3tjgcnAU_w.text: This place never let's me down! A great takeout option ! The meat is always juicy and the various sides are delish!

xXt5kSa8XfdRJUjblGKwzA.text: Delicious.  Great falafel.  Always great service and they're always accommodating.    Also if you're not sure about anything ask if you can taste it, they will gladly let you try anything.

lL_Lwxh-FD2upPgXmBKjQA.text: I had the hummus bowl with chicken and LOVED IT!! Would definitely recommend this place, new favorite! The beet hummus is a must!

O8-4Wp0V_bFN-HltS5b45A.text: Really good felafel, actually, the best that I've had in Arizona. Hummus is always fresh, potatoes and eggplant are awesome. The owner is always there and is so nice to everyone.  It's right by my office so it works perfect for lunch as the service is super quick. It's basically healthy food that's prepared fast. GREAT place, highly recommend it :)

3GcmBL5sE464VYItlIaHrQ.text: Experienced hummus xpress for the first time tonight, and truly enjoyed the experience! The staff was very friendly and helpful and guided me through making my dish. The food was great! I am a fairly picky person and was pleased to find that I loved it! Definitely recommend!

c13j5XHrkggS5Hf-CEmy5Q.text: I actually stumbled upon this place by chance.  I was looking for a place to grab a quick bite in between sessions of my daughter's swim championships.  I was going to go to the juice bar next door but it turned out to be a diet/nutrition place with a membership requirement, so I started talking to Eddie at Hummus Xpress.  He was so incredibly personable and accommodating that I had to give his restaurant a shot.  Everything smelled amazing so it made it an easier decision.  First, let me reiterate....Eddie, the owner, is forthright, honest, and incredibly nice.  As previously mentioned, the concept is like a Mediterranean Chipotle with the difference being this is locally owned and sourced food with lots of organic, vegan friendly, and fresh food.  You pick your choice of bowl, plate, or pita and then add main meat or vegetable component, added toppings such as hummus(6 kinds made fresh daily), tabouli, etc.  From there, you pick topping of sauces, hot sauces, olives, tzatziki amd more.    Eddie will let you sample whatever you would like.  The gyro mean is so tasty but I rolled with the slow roasted braised beef.  All I can say is you must try this place, whether or not you are in the area.  It will be well worth your time.

arvKQzKKh6WJOLUKbt1L_Q.text: I love you.  Fresh, great food.  Great people.  What more can you ask for?  I love Mediterranean food but always struggle with what dish to order, because I want a little of each flavor from each of my favorite dishes.  Problem solved, you can get anything practically here.

1575lniBNy6ls68t5YmNUg.text: I go here pretty regularly (wish it was a tad closer - I would live there).  I love the plate option it is very generous and reasonably priced.  I share it with my daughter and still have some to bring home.  However, this last time I found the perfect combo for me.  Hummus bowl (classic is still my favorite) with the beef (both out of this world) and a side of tabouli.  I am so happy they changed their tabouli to the traditional bulgur wheat.  A fantastic and healthy lunch for $6 (w/o drink).  Gyro meat is good too and all the add-ons make it a perfect fit for your taste buds.  The garlic aioli is a must try.  Made my self hungry - guess I know where I'm going for lunch.

eHmJ72fBkX-I6fZYm9UnBg.text: The options for the bowls is unbelievable - quality ingredients and great flavor. Friendly staff dealt with me wanting to sample everything. Highly recommended for a healthy meal.

B6cYK6asNlDmi9HAlIWz1A.text: My boyfriend and I eat here once a week. The food is great quality, healthy, and delicious. We've never had a bad experience. Everyone that works here is always nice. We are so glad we found this place!

y-ESHNV0OmNRFIYJmGBzjQ.text: When I think of Vegetarian food I think of Hummus Xpress. The food here inspires me.    If I had access to this spot everyday, I would be encouraged to cross over to vegetarianism and feel like I didn't miss out on eating meat. The food is seriously that delicious.   Favorites:   All of the Hummus's! They have flavored hummus that they rotate.  Everyone's fav cilantro jalepeno-a bit too spicy for me. My favorite is the Roasted beet hummus which has a beautiful hot pink color. They are so creative with their hummus!   Eggplant- roasted, creamy, complex and divine!    Roasted broccoli- flavorfully rich roasted goodness  Falaffel- soft fluffy insides with a crunchy exterior and unexpected hint of cardamom   Kale salad- fresh and zingy   $9 for a bowl filled to the brim with diverse veggie goodness.   Forget all the fancy Vegetarian/Vegan places in LA.  I'll take the excellently prepared recipes here, over the fancy pretentious, outrageously priced stuff any day.

77Y5rdVNyc4MPbRr6fwPRw.text: My new favorite place for gyros.  They have so many fillings to choose from you will never run out of combinations.  Like other reviewers have posted, it's like chipotle but for Mediterranean food.  The food tastes great.  I tried the jalapeno hummus and was very pleased.  First time having kale in a gyro and it was very tasty.  Their tea is really good also.  They have mango, peach, and regular. This will be my go to place when I'm in town for business.  Update:  I just got a free baklava!  Flaky, sweet, buttery goodness.  Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gyro pita with kale, cucumber, and jalapeño hummus with iced tea for $6.95!

7OfiwRX1Cv2mUoMGYeLkpQ.text: My favorite restaurant period. I go here when ever I can't decide what I want. It's chipotle style in creation of your bowl, but much better and very flavorful every single time. I always get extra veggies and I know I'm getting good clean food each time.

zJMECi2P0NBJA1ldtS81gQ.text: This place turned out to be a VERY nice surprise. It is definitely similar to Chipotle but the quality of food here is much better in my opinion. Im only comparing it to Chipotle due to the similarites as making your order and choosing what you would like. Fresh cooked veggies, variety in meat and hummus. You also get rice and toppings as well.   Easy quick dinner to pick up and take home and its very filling...and given that you pretty much cannot get anything that's unhealthy here you dont feel as guilty after you stuff your face and devour the whole bowl :)

oXsr5Cb1eYD8B1t9RP1-RQ.text: Their hummus is not good. It was really runny, more like a soup or sauce. For $10 i got 1 scoop of red pepper hummus and 1 scoop of the jalapeno cilantro hummus and 3 pitas. Unfortunately they put both scoops of hummus in the same container and due to their watery consistency it kinda turned into a soup/glop combination of the two after my car ride home. I would rather get my hummus from the grocery store, farmer market, or Haji Babba off McClintock in Tempe.

HZfoW3TK41UvofbWUaEOGQ.text: One of our favorite spots for some good vegan food. The fried eggplant is amazing!! Love the variety of choices and everything tastes awesome together.

WMNCozteRSatKiIAK-lV-g.text: I love this place.  I went back to back days and brought a friend back the next day.  It's Mediterranean food with like a chipotle service model.  Think pita jungle (with actually killer authentic Mediterranean) and chipotles love child.  Prices are normal for lunch I'd say it's going to run about $10 with a drink.  The hummus is awesome though.  The jalepeno cilantro is amazing.  Love love love it

L3-KEMGEOpOUyhT8xoq8ww.text: Hummus Xpress, welcome back. I've missed you. After my gripe about the salad incident, the owner made sure that things were figured out, can't knock that level of dedication to the customer. I want to be clear here, I had frequented the heck out of this place prior to that confusion. I had even gotten my coworkers hooked on it as well. I missed this place, and I am truly glad that all is back.   This place does make good, quick, and relatively healthy food. I could, and some weeks have,  eat the eggplant in excess. It's just so good. The falafel is delicious, and has the right consistency. Sometimes falafel gets dry, or too mushy; it's a tricky thing to tame for those that are comfortable with it. HX gets it right. Not a fan of the mighty chickpea? Try some of the Aleppo Beef. It is juicy and tender, and mixes with most of the other options. Their tabbouleh is also prime. It's the best tabbouleh I've had that wasn't homemade. Finally, it is really rare for me to find good schug in Tempe. It seems like most restaurants I visit stick to the standard spicy sauces that are essentially cayenne and vinegar. Schug is a flavorful addition to the condiment family. It packs a good punch though, so take warning. I pair it with the jalapeno hummus, but that is definitely not for all.     Welcome back to my regular consumption pattern.  I've missed you.

62nfLZREfAZkiytXxqwCvA.text: I heard about this place from some friends. I love hummus and Mediterranean food, so I figured I would check it out. The location is pretty bad. It's in a run down strip mall. I would typically not drive into this area, so don't let that scare you away!  The woman at the counter was very friendly. I informed her I was a new customer and she gave me the basic run down. I decided to get a jalapeno cilantro hummus pita. I added gyro meat and some veggies. It was delicious!!! I ate the entire thing! It was way more food than I needed, and it kept me full for hours!  My only complaint- It was a little messy, which I didn't like. It comes in a red plastic basket with a thin piece of wax paper. Since the pita was so messy, I had to use a knife and fork to eat it. The basket made this difficult. The paper ripped and exposed the basket. I would much prefer to eat off a plate.  Next time I will try a "hummus bowl."  I definitely recommend you try this place out! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outside building
Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jalapeño cilantro hummus pita.

yVejGCWKIM1NCyDABF_Yug.text: Food was really good but be careful with the kalamata olives still have seeds and I was not expecting that as I bit into my pita. :(  Food was good great but, I about chipped a tooth with the first bite.

vRTxYd-KbXArc6bwtFA3HA.text: I would call myself a foodie and have had a lot of Mediterranean food and so the reason I gave this place 2 stars because it the flavors are not quite what I was expecting. It taste like they tried to get too fancy with the food but did not succeed in doing so. The topping they offer have too much going on and leave a weird after taste. They gyro meat is not traditional. It is thick and only somewhat taste like gyro meat. The hummus is ok but it has more liquid than most other hummus. It makes the pita soggy. The pita bread itself is store bought and nothing special about it. But what really moved me to write the review was that I found a hair in my food. I only ate 1/4 of it and was done.

Es2Kvl72vT_C2r7yNmmibg.text: Just went there for a quick lunch and the food was amazing! Very fresh and extremely flavorful. I love places that can transform healthy food into something delicious and this place has it down. Will be back.

yic1ArSuRuwlImK6TuoF9Q.text: We stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon on our way up to Flagstaff. Looking for something fast that wasn't fast food, and this was a hit! We were immediately greeted and served (in and out within about 5 minutes). I ordered the most delicious falafel bowl with rice, white bean salad, glazed carrots, onions, jalapeno and cilantro hummus, feta, and garlic aioli with a wheat pita. Holy flavor, Batman. Pro tip: you can get half and half of two different hummus types if you are indecisive like me. My fiance ordered a gyro on a pita with potatoes and tzatziki, which he happily devoured. It is not the easiest thing to eat while driving (we ended up just pulling over - it was that good) but it was a great way to kick off our road trip. If I was a local, you couldn't keep me away from this place. Can't wait to pass through Tempe again just to be able to come back!!

gxJZnNHf4hIakUxlfAN8GA.text: What a surprise! I got the bowl with jalapeno hummus and gyro with pickled veg and grilled eggplant. Every component of the dish stood on it's own and was even better together. A flavor cataclysm in your mouth.

ut7Pqzfxh8phZ0Ry45yIiA.text: Fabulous find!  After an hour at REI, we were starving and told about this place. It's like a Middle Eastern Chipotle!  You can choose a pita, bowl, plate, or salad and add meat (gyros or veggies, too), vegetables, toppings, flavor of hummus and dressing.  The staff were SO friendly and helpful. The bowl was a perfect size...very filling. You can choose the "regular" flavors or some of the more authentic flavors....like Moroccan veggies. We loved it and wish we lived closer. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Easy parking in a strip mall on a Main Street.
Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. The friendly staff under the blackboard menu.

IaG7CD1Ta8k1L4Brym6_bg.text: Construction shouldn't stop you from eating a dish like this.The menu has actually grown from my last visit it's better.I am all for gluten-free and vegetables yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. This bowl could not hold anything more so said stop.
Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. I like the way this looks in the break room . I&#39;m very busy  chowing on Hummus.

_KAhfsVhXKHsw9vy5uuapw.text: This place is awesome! They have great food and the service is always top notch. It is much like a Mediterranean Chipotle in the sense that you go down the line and choose what you would like for your bowl, plate, or pita. They offer several kinds of meat (gyro, chicken, beef, etc.), many veggies (eggplant, zucchini, kale, seasoned carrots, etc.) and tons of toppings (tabbouleh, tzatziki, garlic aioli, and more). They also have different types of hummus. Try the cilantro jalapeno - it's amazing (although my mom prefers the classic). The staff will guide you and help you choose items that go together. They've never led me astray yet. The owner is friendly, and it feels great to know you're supporting a local business. Oh, and the music they play inside is nice too. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken bowl with rice, eggplant, kale, cilantro jalapeno hummus, tabbouleh, tomato, cucumber, feta, and garlic aioli.

-uT43yhMItcErqrMttBxlg.text: I've been going here regularly for a year now and the standard is always 5 star. Eddie the boss treats his customers extremely well and I am always made to feel welcome.   Not only that though, the food is gorgeous. The gyro is the best I have tasted and the cilantro jalapeno hummus is legendary. Big selection of healthy vegetables and tabouli saves any guilt. They also give you generous portions so it can be split over the day.  Always in my top places to stop by when I am on the move. Best pita place out here. Can't be compared.

_uWO2Pn26wvjG04mG8e0LA.text: One of my favorite places to stop for a quick, healthy, reasonably priced lunch/meal! I originally found this place through their food truck they had at a local festival and loved it so much that I had to pop in to check out their full menu. As other reviews pointed out, Hummus Xpress is basically a Chipotle-style Mediterranean restaurant, as they make your bowl/pita in front of you. Ingredients taste very fresh and the portion sizes are generous. They have tons of options and the hummus and sauces are so so delicious! Definitely worth checking out!

WoN0Y8OHpU0CYwAeEkyEhg.text: If you're trying to eat healthy, Hummus Xpress should be on your radar.  It tastes so good you'll swear it's a cheat meal, but you can make your bowl as healthy as you want.  The bowls are more than enough food for one person.  The plate would be a good idea for two people to share.  You start with rice and top it with one of many protein options.  You then add one of many veggie options like roasted potatoes or eggplant.  Choose one of many types of hummus (my favorite being cilantro jalapeno).  Next comes a salad option.  I love both the tabbouleh and the bean salad.  To top it all off, there are many topping options like feta, onions, cabbage, olives, lettuce, and a variety of others.  I've tried both the tzatziki and the garlic sauce to top everything off, and they were both super flavorful.  When we discovered this place, we had two meals there in one week because it was so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. My loaded bowl!!

ia2NxShwJJcab3Nea8qwpw.text: Think of it like a Mediterranean version of chipotle but even better! We got the plate with chicken and falafel, carrots and potatoes, cilantro jalapeno hummus and a bunch of fresh veggies and feta- topped with taziki! YUMMMMMM it was really delicious and had great flavor and spice! The hummus and carrots were spicy and that's exactly what we wanted! I recommend this place if you're looking for something fast and/or something delicious!

DhxfPwaQtiW1oeeH0APTWQ.text: This place has become one of my favorite fast food spots in Tempe. It's healthy, light, filling, and vegan friendly! They offer so many unique add-on's to their meals and everything tastes so fresh. While operating as if they were a large-scale company, they still have the feel of a family-owned restaurant. Hummus Xpress will definitely be seen in every city in the future. Love the atmosphere too with all of its plants.    Thanks as always Hummus Xpress!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

9AI1uNH7EecdxQqm7avN9Q.text: Can I just say. I LOVE THIS PLACE. From the service, food and taste, portion, freshness and health benefits... Absolutely LOVEE! I decided to go for the plate, in which you can choose 2 proteins, 4 fillings, any topping and sauce. So I went for falafel and chicken, kale, carrots, chickpeas, and olives (these are not pitted, btw). And garlic sauce. It was SO packed with flavor and food. I generally don't eat a lot, so this was actually split into 2 meals for me.   This place was small but chilled. You could eat by yourself near the window sill/counter or sit at table/booth to chat with friends. The guy who works here was also really nice and patient with my order. He was able to recommend some things and made adjustments, if need be.   Overall a great experience. I was pretty satisfied with my meal and I'd come back again whenever I'm in the area next time :)

U-NK5G9T72V2wXBEtppYRA.text: Great customer service! A bit unorganized when I wanted to purchase a gift card but so nice and the problem was resolved.  Food: The flavors are amazing. Very light to eat and cook answered my questions and his suggestions rocked my bowl.  3 starts as the chicken had a few yucky chewy pieces, my fault I should of stuck to vegan.

otCKculz_HvUK4nFr7rWIg.text: Fresh, healthy and delicious.  Perfect lunch spot!

fq3ZCp0AgteMAp-3_3tPFA.text: I watched the female blonde manager wipe her nose 4 times with both hands, no gloves.  Then she touched lids and bowls that were being made. I'm so grossed out. I told the dark haired employee with baseball cap to let the manager know I saw her and it was very unsanitary! Bleh!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Front door

yn1PRubWfxn3WQiRiuS7sA.text: It has been a while since we were here, I thought I did a review but I guess I forgot. Absolutely loved it. The food was so yummy, I love all the choices. The rice was amazing. They were so helpful for us newbies and very friendly. We will definitely be back when in town. Highly recommend!!!

wZE7xm9IwF5f-Rpxq4a_jA.text: So the Hummus Xpress food truck was here at my building and honestly into Gyro meat but since im low carbing it Pita Chips and Hummus are a No No since its not cheat day. I had them make a half chicken/ half Gyro protein bowl. Wow the sauces and meats are a perfect combo of delicious!!! The reviews on yelp do not lie these guys make some great Gyro. Will do this food truck again and the location is on my bucket list when im down in Tempe

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

Mq7F9W45arg45z5Sfk7mbA.text: A compact lunch spot that packs a punch!  I love this place, especially their hot veggies and protein.  I normally place an order for a bowl.  Once you decide on a protein, you fill it with a veggie (I love the eggplant), pick a hummus flavor (they have 4 to choose from) and a salad.  I usually end up ordering extra veggies and you'll pay extra for it.  Top it off with a sauce and you'll see your bowl filled up pretty quickly.  Very filling and yes, you will walk out with dragon breath but it's totally worth it.  Just make sure to pack some gum or mints.  For dessert, they offer baklava and cookies.  You'll walk out thinking why you didn't come sooner.    The place gets pretty busy at lunch but the line moves quickly so don't despair.  Parking is tight but totally worth it.  If the place runs out of seating, they will conveniently pack it to take back to work.  Go, what are you waiting for...GO!

GR59pHSSJDFWHaeJ-w8SfQ.text: First let me just say how excited I was for this restaurant seeing I've never ordered from you before.. however after today I won't be ordering again. Im really disappointed.  I've never given a bad review. The lamb was way over salted, it over powered the plate.  But the part that won't have me returning is the hair I found in my food.  Please wear a hair net. Threw out the rest of my lunch.  Order number: 13302668. Sorry but a hairy salt lick was not planned for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

qR0Y2gg5JeYQPkRZlgCYhA.text: First I will say this. I LOVE finding a small hole in the wall restaurant with amazingly deliciously fresh food. It doesn't matter where it is, what it looks like, if the service and food are top knotch, I'll go. I first tried hummus xpress when my gf brought home take out. It had been sitting for awhile and I was hungry but man was it good! It left such an impression I couldn't wait to visit in person. Since that day, I've been back only twice mainly because I don't live or work near the area but if I did, oh boy I'd need gift cards because I'd be there regularly. Everything I tried is insanely flavorful, so fresh, so good, the combinations are absolutely endless! It'll never get boring. Definitely recommend this place. Get a wrap, or a bowl, just go already. You won't be disappointed.

an0sbvKQEJLK9EeRh1IH4w.text: This is not my first time there as there food is usually delicious. Today a co-worker went to pick up lunch for me. Gave her my order (in the order and how I usually order) as I have done when I go in there myself. Very disappointed she came back with a "bowl" if I had to measure it probably had about a spoonful of rice, 3 not 4 olives hummus was in a small container . I would compare the size of a container to the container you receive at Cane's with their chicken dipping sauce. The falafel did not taste recently made but tasted like they been there for a while. In addition when it came to the hummus it tasted like the hummus was expired or maybe it was too much lemon/lime in it. Definitely not worth the $8.50 plus tax for a bowl. Will not be going back disappointed

Q7XL8xcYS1NCgtPx0G6Xxw.text: The veggie bowl is awesome.  You get to pick your toppings.  I always opt for easy rice, and lots of eggplant, broccoli, and potatoes.  I love the selection of veggie toppings ranging from pickled veggies to kalamata olives to tabouli .  They usually have several different hummus flavors to pick from.  My personal favorites are the beet hummus, and the Jalapeno cilantro hummus.  And top it all off with a lil shug sauce, and you have yourself a fresh lunch with a lil kick of heat from the shug sauce.

yuJrbPK0yfCjYSQftTyAEA.text: Chipolte decided to do Gyros... that's the idea of this place.  So good! So many options and the service is stellar.    If you go for lunch, be sure to go early as the place does fill up.

6Sn03aewvtYytAkYlpWtSA.text: Uhm, wow! The amount of flavor they pack into a bowl here is amazing! The vegan options are so plentiful I had a hard time deciding what to get. It's a counter serve, Chipotle style fast casual "build your own" kind of place. I got a bowl with falafel, jalapeno hummus, veggies and spicy chug sauce. The spicy hummus and sauce were intense! It was also enough food for two other meals for me!   The service was fast and friendly, and they were helpful when I was indecisive about what to get. It can be overwhelming trying to decide! I hope to return soon!

TkqeQps5rUXiGRWJHl6q5g.text: Great food, great set-up! For those of you who haven't been here think of it like Chipotle except Mediterranean and better and fresher. Everything is amazing, I love their Gyro meat and the fried Eggplant. A must try spot for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

9DfKW1XqDow4uXjcdI8eww.text: This place is my favorite Greek ever! It's like a chipotle style in the way you order. Extremely flavorful!! I love the jalapeno hummus and tabouli. 10x better than all the Greek places near by. Terrible hours however, I normally eat dinner when they close at 8, and they're closed on Sundays.

qVxY43rQHgLNNnHYFTjTXA.text: This is absolutely my favorite places for Mediterranean food. The food is amazing and they are always seeking to improve their food and image as well. Their food trucks are fantastic too! It's nice to see healthy options at events since usually it's just "fast food," but they provide legitimate healthy fast food. Definitely recommend trying the ginger brew!

zIW7cnwBcZvsgpDape0ZmA.text: I have been going to this establishment since they opened their doors and they have the most amazing food.  I have been to many other Mediterranean/Greek restaurants etc but none compare.  Restaurant quality food without the wait.  They have the best falafel ever.  I would recommend this place to any one.  It is a cohesion of Mediterranean, Greek and Persian inspired foods that work so well together.

PurjVDZgrs0_SiR27m6v2w.text: Delicious! I eat here whenever I'm in town. They offer different types of hummus and you can mix and match what's added to your dish. My favorite place for Mediterranean food. Very friendly and helpful staff.

z2gVms5ZgkIlVh9q69Lt1Q.text: Similar concept to Chipotle, but Mediterannean style. The portions were large and the price was good. You either get to choose a plate, pita, or bowl. You then go down the row and get to pick a meat, hummus, salad, and cooked vegetable option as well as unlimited raw vegetable toppings. I order half grilled chicken, half falafel bowl with grilled zucchini, tabouleh, a combination of lemon/ginger and jalapeno/cilantro hummus, and a ton of vegetable toppings. Everything tasted incredible and the employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I will definitely be coming back here!

SMxLFPOpSQ3NkbBo4s3mEA.text: Delicious!! We've been craving Lebanese food and are so happy that there's a place in the valley that has Lebanese dishes! Awesome concept-- can mix and match tons of middle eastern sides and dishes. All are so good. The falafel, basil cilantro hummus, rice pilaf, and shoug(?), and eggplant are so tasty. Great because you can mix and match to get lots of variety and flavor. The owner is really nice and super friendly too. An ideal place for vegetarians.

r-BavVw3ndNem3h-1KCVPw.text: Me and my fiancee came here weekly for the longest time and quality is always top notch but when they have circulated through so many different employees it's hard to keep up with how to order. Example u get double choice of meat that would mean if u wanted only gyro meat u would get two sides before now they charge u extra for not extra when u get the bowl we gave up after being up charged a few times so sad bc the guys that used to work there were awesome! Prices are a little high I'd be willing to pay it more for the double meat if I got it :(

p_UuRCzYnTf-Bk3_28OFZg.text: I used to frequent this joint about twice a week. Great food. I typically get the bowl with chicken or gyro meat. Only issue is they're SUPER chintzy when adding toppings. I.e. Onions, tomatoes, etc

ItruuJSBX97yFeZrmLxd-w.text: Fine alternative to the area but average grub. Had the falafel bowl and was not impressed with it. Small size, small quantity and bland. Sides were dry (rice, green beans), humus was alright. Can't comment on the meat. Won't be back here but glad I tried the place.

ZjnW8CdoHw34kQrWWPTDXQ.text: like a mediterranean chipotle. really good portions for the price

xOw4GZ0eVnZt-yPy84hRdw.text: So based on the outrageous reviews I just stopped here for lunch.  They must be padding their reviews based on my experience. I ordered a pita with grilled chicken, jalapeno hummus and kale.  I also ordered a side of falafel.  The pita was ok enough.. Nothing really special with it or the chicken.  It was nice to have kale, one of my favs, as a topping.  The falafel was brought out to my table and was really dark brown turning to blackish. I tried part of one and they were disgusting.  I took them back to the counter and being full from the pita, told the guy I didn't want anything else but they should be a bit more care because the falafel was way too fried.  He promptly told me I didn't know what I was talking about.  That he's from Lebanon and has eaten falafel his whole life.  I said it's still over fried.  He then ask me if I wanted him to give it to me raw because he could do that...I turned, said 'interesting customer service here' and left.  I'd never go back and would recommend you don't either.

5zOjFSJQAlYYcqFtE3G1xg.text: I'm in love with this new lunch spot!!  My first time there I ate in, not realizing the sheer volume of food I would receive.  I ate the 1/3 I could cram into my stomach and then on a whim drove 20 miles to deliver the rest of my delectable pita lunch to my flavor-loving man! I stayed while he ate and all was quiet except for frequent appreciative sighs ;).  That says it all!

zzgocrGH3SmJEs0TJ0LIwg.text: The place is legit.  I had chicken and falafel.  The falafel was a little dry but everything else was very, very good.  Good rice.  Very good hummus.  Someone wrote it was like Mediterranean Chipotle.  It kind of is.  You build your own bowl or plate.  It is unique and really good.   The people helping are also fantastic.   I will go back when in town.  Thanks Yelp community for this find.

LNtOFndLzgchsl3RjE3YwQ.text: Came here because my friends were in the mood for rice, but gotta say, the cilantro jalepeno hummus was the star of the plate we split. Went with a plate so we could try lots of different stuff all mixed together and it turned out to be a ton of food that we barely finished between two people.  All for less than 11 bucks! Love the carrots and the potatoes. The guys were super helpful and explained all of the options and gave recommendations. Will definitely be back.

DqI_dUOzXBn-Q6PWK5LIww.text: you can make your own bowl alot of variety and its really tasty owners are friendly

2VlArPf3qN2CA5lijE4fPA.text: I love this place. The food is great and you get a lot of food for your money. The staff is very friendly and considerate. BUT FOR THE LOVE OF GOD! Put on some gloves!!! It is disgusting! I think this is mostly the younger guys that work here and not the owner. One young man had two gloves on, one had one glove on. He grabbed plates and pitas with his bare hands, and the cashier had no gloves on. I watched the cashier touch money, touch food items, then touch money again. Luckily he didn't handle any of my food, I would have politely asked him to put gloves on. He did scoop a side of sauce for us sans gloves, he dipped his finger in the first cup, he tossed that one, scooped another and spilled it on his hand. He then went back to cashiering. This grosses me out to no end. So unsanitary. Please please please educate your employees on food handling!

KqlfrO3vC5OJIwJJn5oP_A.text: One of the best food places in Tempe! Everything is made in house, is super fresh, and incredibly tasty. The gyro meat is the best I've had. And the prices are unbeatable. Ive met the owner and hes very passionate about the food and his restauarant. Cannot recommend enough! Do yourself a favor and eat at Hummus Express!

GLezrrBx4dGpapgT3995Rw.text: I eat here about twice a week. Eddie, the owner and chef, is super passionate about his food, and he and the whole crew are always friendly. Every meal I've ordered has been delicious and fresh. I love the different hummus options, and the falafel is really special with lots of herbs. The food is served Chipotle style, with lots of different fillers and toppings. Eat here, you will not regret it!

p71hXphpyvdGzDtEg2J2CA.text: Food is good and fresh. I am a regular there for lunch. Two minor issues are - firstly that there are multiple attendants and sometimes the serving size really varies from bowl full to bowl 3/4 full. And secondly usage of same serving spoon/tongs for all meats is a bit of a growl for me - It doesn't bother me but I would prefer if serving spoon/tongs are kept separate. The attendants are very polite and nice and almost always wish you when you arrive and when you leave.

70p6SK3CZ6wN1IFB76OyXQ.text: Amazing...will be back with all my friends!   Extraordinary flavors!   Get the large bowl and have 3 meals for leftovers!  Gyro meat is the best...just plain awesome for the whole experience!   Great customer service tops it off!

8HpFeGbXGEOmIs-tpj0Kdg.text: I want to preface my review with the fact that my Mediterranean knowledge is based on a handful of places in the valley; some better than others, (in my opinion).  At the risk of the yelp*ing community throwing themselves off Camelback mountain, I have to say that Pita jungle sort of sets the bar for me when it comes to overall taste, portion size, and quality.  Having said that, I was fortunate to try Hummus Xpress (hard to take the place serious with the name) this afternoon.  Based on the reviews alone, I was expecting a lot and was not disappointed. Live music, handful of tables, not much of a line and fairly straightforward system of ordering.  If you read more than two other reviews, I don't have to repeat the process.  It was nice to get some guidance from the line, though I was a little confused by the pricing aspect: .60 cents per item on veggies.  I wasn't clear if that was across the menu or just that region but I was so aware of it that it kept me from really wanting to pile on anymore than a single veggie.  Portion size was adequate, the bowl can hold a lot of food and you fill the bowl easily with delicious ingredients.  I sampled a few flavors of hummus and too be honest, I prefer my hummus warm which this was not but was still tasty.  What seems like a limited menu actually is fairly vast and it would be possible to have the same thing twice only by accident.  Pitas were soft and warm and the iced tea was special.  Push-button iced tea is an abomination so it was nice to see handwritten exotic flavors that didn't make you roll your eyes.  Hummus Xpress (*sigh) is now in the rotation and on the board for a good quality lunch.

zI9J0-ZDoSOWO38rv2myKA.text: Delicious options to make your bowl your way. Their staff is very friendly and always greet you (and remember you if you frequent) they offer samples of the hummus if you're not sure which one to get.

h14mkwm81nPvQ0kZYs_MCw.text: Food was delicious, healthy, and fresh. Lots of vegetarian options. The owner was extremely kind and generous. Overall, a wonderful dining experience!

5IF6tDUduPTX_LhoXrAccA.text: This place is awesome. So many healthy and tasty options.  It's set up like a Chipotle where you select what you want as they are plating it up.   This is a new regular place for me.

dMu4s2Ur3RszRbGbxNX8ig.text: A build your own bowl style restaurant with terrific Mediterranean fixings.  All of the ingredients are fresh, the flavors are amazing, and the bowl combinations are amazing! All of the employees have been super friendly and always make me smile, as the friendliness is contagious.  One of my favorite places to eat in Tempe.

wye6KgY4DShRpH13oEdwsg.text: Hot pink hummus? Now you're speaking my language. This place is like a delicious choose your own Mediterranean flavor adventure.   You can get a pita, salad or bowl and fix it up the way you want- sort of like Chipotle or Cafe Rio. Everything I tried was outstanding. I had two kinds of hummus- beet and cilantro. The star for me was beet. It was slightly sweet and so pretty on the plate- neon pink!  The chicken was tender and flavorful and the bowl had saffron rice which was also a delight. The tzatziki sauce had a slight spicy kick which I've never had, but ended up really enjoying as well.   The owner was working the counter and he was so nice. I really hope this place does well.   I'll be back for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bowl with all the fixins!

GroZfTavmq2P2YKpXUghlA.text: This is one of my favorite places to go for dinner. They provide a rare combination of health and taste, tradition and innovation!  Be sure to try the creative types of hummus that they make and the garlic aoli.   The staff is very hospitable and they will take the time to guide you through the process.  This is one of the few restaurants that will make you crave vegetables. I encourage you to try the ginger carrots, roasted eggplant, and the various ways that they prepare kale.  I have nothing but good things to say about Hummus Xpress.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great night at hummus xpress! Great Peace Feast with all of the people from Redemption Church and elsewhere!
Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

4xjhTsOJKqlWgu-ABFJMag.text: I need to Xpress my appreciation for this place.  Hummus Xpress is all about cafeteria-style, mix and match Mediterranean food.  You start with a plate, a bowl, or a pita, then pick a meat (or an non-meat, or no meat), some veggies (lots of choices), some hummus (or not) and then a salad and rice (or not), and then maybe a sauce (or not).  Do it yourself--get a lot of a little or a little of a lot--however you want it.  There's always many choices.  Their hummus is shot through with kale and cilantro--enough to add greens and a little spice, but not too much.  Falafel?  Fala-full of flavor.  Nothing is pre-made, EVERYTHING is fresh.  Great taste, great price, nice and fast, extreme service.  Good for lunch or dinner or a snack.  Veggie friendly.  Work nearby? Lunch.  Live nearby?  They deliver.  Do it.

cS65_yosnG_LWqBd5LE3NA.text: I am soooooooooooooooooooooooooo excited about this place!! Quick and delicious! Just as another reviewer described, it's like the Mediterranean  version of Chipotle. You do order from right to left, you get to pick your rice, meat and veggie, hummus and as many toppings as you would like (like olives, and, other things... yeah, I was only interested in the olives)   I was actually expecting the food not to be too fresh since it's basically served buffet style, but it was surprisingly fresh and perfect! I had the gyro meat and I honestly think it's the best gyro meat I've had in Tempe so far. Super moist and flavorful and it didn't give me indigestion! The hummus was really good, I had the plain one (If someone can't make plain hummus right, then there is no point in trying the flavored ones) It was good!!! I asked if it was made in house or bought, they told me everything is made in house.  Even the drinks were exciting! I had lavender-peach tea. It was fresh and I loved that it wasn't sweetened. Don't forget to check in and get a free tea!   This will definitely be a regular lunch spot for me....how can you beat cheap, fresh and delicious?

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mmmm my gyro bowl....

V7nCI6OMRRA6EzWuGZB8BA.text: Always fresh and tasty. Great options for vegetarian and non-vegetarians alike. The pita is overflowing and the grilled veggies are awesome.

_cedrnRXJWDUPrbD7IlGng.text: Good tasty and lots of options for meat and veggies.  Reasonable value.  What makes this place special is the variety of veggies you can get in your meal and not heavily processed food.  Sodium in chicken and gyro was not excessive

KOZf_-qnzRbfdJjcHKxBcw.text: My first time to this place and from out of town. Went there for lunch and it was amazing! Customer service was excellent! Also, I will be back there for dinner.

Tnoqzd5Vgyhki2yQReLYIw.text: Absolutely awesome concept! Tons of vegetarian and vegan options (all labeled such) for building a plate, pita sandwich or bowl.  Way too many things to list, but I chose a bowl with rice, 1 veggie, 1 hummus, and falafal served with a side of pita.   Owner is great if you're a first timer walking you through the options and makes great suggestions. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner - seriously - GO HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bowl with rice, broccoli, kale salad, falafal, and darn near every veggie

4fsGS3le0Dq_Vuvu_Z3_ag.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots.  Have yet to have anything but a positive experience.  Staff is always friendly and the food is some of the best.

LCBnJhsQ76Q1yA2c35SdtQ.text: Still amazing every time. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews people don't know what good food is! Just tried halal guys at Grand opening and this is still my favorite place to eat in tempe!

4kwhxhQGObBuJbkEB1tULQ.text: I love hummus and I love "build your own" restaurants so this place is perfect!! There are a lot of options so every bowl/plate is unique. The veggies are fresh and well seasoned. I love all the sauces and the option to have a little spicy kick in my dish if I'm feeling up for it. Fast, friendly service makes this a place I'll return to often.

_8pI8CrISgRr3IMBzSNMFQ.text: I love this place, the have 6 different flavors of delicious hummus and lines are never too long.  the food is healthy balanced and the portions are big.    Good Job Hummus Xpress, count with me as a frequent client  :)

-oZLBy6VzAv-GKDiDN6XZQ.text: What a wide array of selections they have here!  Today I got a lunch bowl with gyro meat, eggplant, rice, lentil and kale salad, cilantro and jalapeno hummus and pita.  All followed by their homemade fresh brewed mint iced tea.  For my listening pleasure they had on an oldies jazz station that played the classic - "The A Train".

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lunch!

wqlwhqA-qN3ItROCmgH6Cg.text: I love Greek Food! So when I found out we were catering in for a work meeting I was excited to try something new.   It was a little difficult navigating the menu that we had, post card sized, and didn't list all the options and had some options listed that were not available any longer. Not to worry though, the manger was very helpful in breaking it all down.   We ordered a lot of food, pretty much min one of everything and doubled up on a few others. We had lamb, and chicken and falafel, and 6 kinds of hummus, and sauces galore. They delivered right on time, helped me get everything set up, they provided all the utensils and plates, and were very nice. Everything tasted super fresh and I am pretty sure we ate happily for at least two days.   I have yet to stop in to the location for a single meal, but next time I am in the area I will surely try. Highly recommend for your office event.

yXdDyBl2ugGsXUfnmSj4lQ.text: I have been going to this place for almost two years. Absolutely the best! Tons of vegetarian options where you dont feel screwed by being a vegetarian!!

BV4KKB6ZutQiBISHwvCiig.text: My husband won't stop talking about this place, I finally put my foot down and said I'm going in!!! It's such a cute place, I'm loving the decor, not too crowded and it gives almost a relaxing feel from the hot blazing sun outside!  If you've ever been to chipotle you'll notice it's almost the same concept! The customer service is amazing! The moment we walked in, we were greet and the man was so eager to assist us. You know how you can tell when someone is confident in their food, well we certainly saw it from the gentleman helping us! He took the time to explain how it worked and then we were off on our hummus Xpress!!  We both ended up with a bowl, the chicken was amazing, tender and very seasoned! The hummus was fresh and the eggplants delicious!!!! You wouldn't think there was a lot of food until you actually sat down and started eating it! It was so filling!!   If you check in with yelp I did see they were offering a free sweet tea drink! I'm so happy I grabbed one of the walnut baklva!! Oh my Buddha!! This was the most amazing dessert I've ever had! Next time I'm not sharing and getting my own!   No wonder my husband raves about this food truck! The prices are fair for what you get! It's amazing! I recommend you give them a try! xO2iGure_VBTaRSNUu1oag.text: Welcome to Mediterranean Chipotle!  Okay, that's perhaps a little oversimplified and I'm guessing its a frequent comparison that drives owner Eddie Hantas nuts.  Nevertheless, the fast casual flow of the counter and the numerous possible ingredient combinations will no doubt feel eerily familiar to Chipotle goers.  Opened in 2012, Hummus Xpress is out to give the people what they want.  Tasty food at a good price, served at warp speed.  The buzz was enough to send me over to their Tempe location at warp speed on a Saturday for lunch.  Look for Hummus Express amongst a throng of small businesses in a strip center on the northwest corner of Broadway and Hardy in Tempe.  Inside, a small restaurant that seats maybe 25-30 people awaits.  I'd heard the crowds here for lunch can be epic so I arrived just after 11am.  Good move (only 3 in front of me).  As mentioned earlier, the ordering system is Chipotle-esque.  Step on up and follow the flow chart above from right to left.  Start with a format.  Choose from a pita, bowl, salad or plate (I opted for a bowl, which comes with rice).  Then choose from 4 meats (I went with gyros).  Then pick a vegetable (I went broccoli).  Then pick a hummus (I went jalapeno cilantro).  Then pick a salad (I chose tabouli).  And lastly, dress your meal with one of over a dozen add ons (I added chickpeas and salsa).  You also get your choice of a piece of white or wheat pita bread (white for me They do honor the Yelp check in for a free tea, but I opted for a water instead.  Lastly, I grabbed a piece of baklava (because of course).  Total cost for everything plus tax? $12.  The verdict?  Delicious.  And why not?  I basically made it myself.  In all seriousness though, Chef Hantas puts out a great product with great ingredients.  Great meats, great veggies, and great pita bread (from Baiz Market, no less).  Couple that with a simple ordering process and I can well imagine the throngs that come here to get their lunch fix during the workweek.  In addition to their brick and mortar operation, Hummus Xpress also operates a food truck and offers catering options.  Lightning quick customizable Mediterranean.  Chipotle should be so lucky to offer a product this good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. My custom bowl, some white pita bread, and a piece of baklava.  It&#39;s Chipotle, but Mediterranean (and better)

GIz7zdBl_o4a4ug8wbzoXg.text: Great price, fresh flavorful food and friendly service. Can't beat it!  They have more options than you can imagine. Salad, pita, bowl or plate just to get you started. WXVdKIYIPFjVTxAzatBfOA.text: Audio express, your home-home-home...  Just kidding. Looking for a new place to try and i chose this one from my never ending list. I walked in and sat at a table waiting for my friend and observed my surroundings. They've got a cool planter in the front with various plants which was unique. I looked through their menu and picked out what I thought would be a good combination.  When we got to the counter to order, I chose the white pita and got classic garlic hummus, flavored hummus can be overrated. They had falafel as a protein and I ordered that, which was a solid decision because they made them fresh. After that, I got roasted garlic red potato as my hot filling, lentil kale salad, and toppings: tomatoes, cucumbers, kalamata olives, green onions, pickled beets, and garlic aioli (can you tell I like garlic?) I was warned the olives were pitted and yet I still forgot and almost chomped down on one. Also I wouldn't get the beets next time, the sweet flavor threw me off. Otherwise, the mix of ingredients was tasty. I did have trouble eating the pita as the contents kept falling out, but it was fairly filling. I also got iced tea for checking in, score.  Honestly the concept of this place was strange to me, I wasn't sure if I'd like mixing all these ingredients together but it worked for the most part. Now I just need to fine tune which combos work best together.

KPPdPdl9M6nt2l0EFtTSOg.text: Whoever left a review and said it was like a Greek Chipotle (there were many of you) really hit the nail on the head. It's pretty much exactly like Chipotle in terms of ordering and portion sizes. (BUT they were significantly more stingy than Chipotle when you ask for more toppings.)  It's not made apparant, but you can ask for unlimited toppings at the end. It's the step after the meat and "special" veggie section, and before the sauces area. If you're confused, I'm convinced they do it on purpose.. because they don't label the "unlimited" area like the others, and there's no sign that says toppings are included. But somehow, everything else is labeled perfectly lol.  Anyways, each bowl comes with a pita, which is awesome. Also, my food tasted amazing, especially the eggplants. The eggplants were REALLY good, I highly recommend them.  It's important to note that it's a little more expensive than Chipotle. It costs about $18 for two bowls, without tip. Not really happy about that price.  Can't say I didn't love my food though. I really, really enjoyed my gyro bowl!

8IPuPqp5-F4KDGMBjU1TVg.text: "Build your Own" Mediterranean bowls and plates? Why yes! Please and thank you!! I love Mediterranean food. I love the option to customize my Mediterranean food exactly how I want so I'm a fan indeed. This was my first time visit and I was so torn between ordering the bowl vs. the plate.  The lady behind the counter told me the plate is huge but carry and heats up well so I'll have plenty of leftovers. The plate comes with 2 meats and all the fixings your heart desires. The bowl comes with 2 meat + all the fixings. I went with the plate for my first visit.  I ordered the braised beef and grilled chicken plate with rice. I topped it with the following items:   Ginger carrots, grilled eggplant, chickpeas, lemon flavored kale, sauteed onions, beets, white bean salad, cucumbers, tomatoes, roasted red pepper hummus, and tzatziki sauce. Upon first bite, I'm like Whoa! This is delicious. Upon third or fourth bite I realized I had too many flavors and textures together and it was a little strange. The braised beef was warm, the rice was warm but everything else was cold, including the chicken. The chickpeas taste like they came out of the can and into some sort of sauce. That was kinda weird but overall I enjoy it.   On my next visit I'll leave out the tomatoes and cucumbers as they do not carry over well for leftovers and I'll probably leave off the hummus. That too taste too store bought.   Lastly, all of the bowls and plates comes with pita bread. You can get white or wheat pita bread. It was hard as a brick. It comes rolled up in foil. It was so hard and cold that when I hit it against the table it sounded as if it was an object, not a piece of bread. It's free but skip it. You won't miss a thing!

f3obiHGZokawZ9E-e5sXDw.text: I would not have known about this place but for friends posting pictures of amazing looking hummus bowls on instagram. This place is tucked into a strip mall that, for whatever reason, I have never had occasion to visit despite living 1/4 mile from it for the majority of my adult life. Although strip mall is generally depressing (it's next to an MMJ doctor and a dry cleaner) the atmosphere is clean and modern if a bit stark.   A reviewer below mentioned that this is sort of a middle eastern Chipotle, which is a useful comparison. You basically chose a bowl, a pita, or a platter. Each option entitles you to a certain number of meats (or vegetables) and an unlimited number of toppings. The proprietor is more than friendly and guides you through the process, perhaps a bit too thoroughly, but it's great to see an engaged small business owner who cares about his product.   The food is outstanding. I'm a vegetarian and my girlfriend is vegan and there were plenty of options. Every filling was extremely flavorful in a non-cloying way. Sometimes the prospect of eating vegetables and hummus leaves something to be desired, but dishes like the roasted eggplant, cous cous, and the various hummuses (hummusi?) were so interesting and complex that I was excited to go back and try the dishes I missed.   I would have given the place 4 stars if not for one quibble - VEGAN TAX. Allow me to explain. Some establishments, this one included, do not deduct a dollar (or two) for omitting meat from the meal. There is no way that hummus costs as much as lamb, so in theory, a vegetarian bowl should reflect the difference in price. Instead of reducing the price accordingly, places that charge the same essentially profit from the difference between the cost of a meat dish and that of a vegan dish. In my opinion, this shouldn't be passed off on vegans/vegetarians, and essentially operates as a tax on vegans. If the guy lowered the price of a veggie pita/bowl/platter, I would go here more often.  Vegan tax aside, the food is great and fresh and the staff is nice. I'll definitely go here again and would recommend it to friends.

X0RnTM_To7uWZtSMEUpsDw.text: Hummus Xpress was quite the pleasant surprise.  I enjoyed the variety of options, friendly/prompt service, and the fresh quality of food. It was very affordable and a great place to lunch it up. The establishment was clean(a big deal).

KhUhzZWhGTa4WwDJjz9jVQ.text: I live right near this place and had been meaning to stop by; it is always a pleasure to see a new local business pop up. My fiance's Vegan sister was in town and we needed to get something quick and tasty after a long day. I took orders and left for my one block journey. When I arrived the two gentleman working greeted me with smiles and took some time to get to know me. Everything looked AMAZING! I told them I needed something vegan and Eddie took it upon himself to create a masterpiece of Mediterranean Vegan friendly meals. They let me sample anything I wanted and I ended up with a wonderful gyro bowl with caramelized egg plant, roasted potatoes, and so many other yummy things. I would give this place 5 stars for their customer service alone, but they have amazing food as well.

lZ6qoDvT3F_yQ3hOt3OtMQ.text: I really enjoy the fresh taste and the atmosphere ! The restaurant is always clean warm and inviting and not  crowded either  .The idea of the way you order is like Chipotle .  You start with a pita of your choice white or wheat then have the employees pile what ever sounds good to you .The cooked veggies I am not a fan of but everything else is fresh light and delicious ! The employees are always friendly and will let your try samples before giving you a generous spoon full .The different hummus choices sound odd but once you try them you'll be hooked !! I like getting alot of food for a good price and this place is great for the amount you get .  My only complaint is my husband and I  tried the baklava once it was really rich and flaky like it was supposed to be but a bit over priced for such a tiny piece.One day I will have to try the falafals . My only wish is that my current apartment was closer ;) so I could eat it more often .All in all if your looking for something fresh different and something your gluten free , vegetarian or carnivore people in your life will like this is a great hole in the wall !

O8c2tHdKOh32oqJ1sjnKpQ.text: Today was my first visit here and I am obsessed already! Staff is incredibly friendly, there was live music on a Wednesday afternoon which was a nice touch. The process was explained to us (similar to chipotle style of ordering) and the combinations are endless. The ingredients are fresh as can be and the portions are perfect. I had a chicken bowl with the lentil kale salad and cilantro jalapeno hummus with a number of toppings. You get a free tea when you check in on here and I got the desert blossom black tea, delicious! I'm already looking forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States

6l5L9cNMtlS7GqjJ648dFg.text: We happened on this place by accident the other day. We were waiting for our car to be done at the mechanic so we wandered down Broadway, saw this place and decided to grab some food... Best accident ever!   We were greeted by a very friendly staff, who explained how it all worked. Basically, they're a self-proclaimed Mediterranean Chipotle, but SO MUCH BETTER!   You have a choice of a pita, a bowl or a plate. We chose a plate, and opted to share it, and it was more than enough food! You get saffron rice, and then choose your veggie (we went with grilled zucchini and kale), and your protein (chicken, falafel, gyro, beef), we chose gyro. Then you move down and pick your hummus, they usually have 3 or 4 different flavours (we went with cilantro jalapeno), and salad (we got tabouleh). But wait! You're not done yet! Then you pick your "accessories": diced onions, pickles, olives, lettuce, tomatoes, etc etc. All designed to compliment your meal. We went with diced onions, pickles and kalamata olives.   Oh my goodness. This was seriously the best $11 I've ever spent at a restaurant. The gyros was tender and flavourful, the saffron rice was a great touch. The veggies weren't soggy. The cilantro jalapeno hummus had an amazing kick to it, and we thought it was better than most of the hummus you find at Trader Joes, AJ's, etc. The tabouleh was so bright and refreshing. The portion in the plate was perfect for the two of us to share. They didn't really skimp on anything.   I was thoroughly impressed with the whole thing. The guys were super nice, the food was amazing and the price was more than right.   The only downside which caused me to take away a star, was that there didn't seem to be a restroom. We thought it was a little odd, but then, we also didn't ask if there was restroom. But since there's usually a sign indicating where the potty is, and the only door led back to kitchen, it seemed safe to assume there was no where to go... if you needed to... you know... go.   Other than that, I highly recommend Hummus Xpress!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Xpress - Tempe, AZ, United States. Thank you, Hummus Xpress, for just being awesome!

-HEwRBF76zTQwhnzRlzTnw.text: High Quality, 'Chipotle' Style Mediterranean Food  This is as good as it gets! Service is always very very friendly and their food is fresh, home-made, vegan/vegetarian, and tasty! I am always impressed by the quality of vegetables and meats, their gyro is some of my favorite, the grilled chicken a close second. Their hummus is a huge bonus, made in house, they typically have 6 different types that rotate. I can't decide which is my favorite they are all unique and delicious. Lemon ginger is fantastic,  you won't find it anywhere else, and the cilantro jalapeno is great if you like spice. I recommend any of their 3 or 4 different kale salads as well as their spicy ginger carrots. The 'pita' sized plate is more than enough food for one, and is just around $6 or $7. You won't regret going here.

GejN84gTH3FPPyx0t46XaQ.text: I frequent this restaurant for multiple reasons.  1.) Good value. If you want a bowl, you have two options: Bowl or Plate. They're basically the same, except for the Plate is bigger and gives choice of 2 meats and 2 grilled vegetables instead of 1 meat and 1 vegetables. The Bowl is plenty of food for a meal. The Plate is almost impossible to finish in a sitting... I always have leftovers so keep this in mind when ordering.  2.) Delicious! Everything mixes together really well. My ultimate picks are: rice, double-eggplant, chicken and gyro, classic hummus, white bean salad, cucumber, beets, olives, and cheese, and double red chili garlic sauce (2nd sauce costs extra, which I usually don't pay for, but I said this was my ultimate), and white pita.  The flavor is really good, and unique. I don't know anywhere else I could buy something comparable, and I have tried other hummus-bowl type restaurants. Nothing is as good as this one.  3.) Very healthy. If you read point 2, you'll see that you get all whole ingredients with a good mix of vegetables, meat, and rice.   I'd recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a quick, healthy meal. It's similar to Chipotle, except a better value, healthier, and a completely different flavor/cuisine.

VmttR98VKcRQkpO2M6ON0w.text: I am hoping I just caught this place on a bad night...  After reading all the great reviews on this place and only living .6 miles away, we opted for takeout. I went in and if I were just giving stars for the staff and customer service I would give it 5 hands down. They were not only super helpful, but very friendly and enjoyable.   The food... It looked good, and they way they described it was enticing, but my boyfriend and I did not like it. It is just like a Chipotle for Greek food, and very quick. Although, maybe since we eat at places that cook our food to order, we are just spoiled. Most of our food was cold, the chicken and potatoes and like I said I live less than 5 minutes away, so it wasn't he time between the restaurant and home. We did warm it in the microwave, but I ended up eating the tasty (and only hot item) wheat pita and tossing the rest.   So, as I said earlier I am hoping this was an off night, and from my experience I wouldn't recommend, but maybe we will try again another night.

nQ4NcO7wCRATBybguBSzuA.text: Awesome food, good customer service.   If you're unsure ask what they recommend , always good suggestions.

D4XC9A19F4INJl6Kzt4T5g.text: Very peppy and polite servers! The food was GREAT. So full of flavor and fresh. I already can't wait till my next meal from Hummus Express!

PxL0ebibqIADQ8dECPGwGg.text: This place is INSANELY GOOD! Every item on the menu is tasty af. They have serious gluten free options as well as some vegan options. It's like a chipotle for Greek food X1000. So good. Hummus Xpress. Actually nearly fast food.

-O2xzkaRk6ZavYOUu3ehZQ.text: Delicious and fresh! Their garlic aioli and lemon ginger hummus have me totally addicted!

_A_okZg_f-29t1CzZmA_XA.text: Chipotle meets the Mediterranean! You choose your portion size, meat (gyro, beef, chicken, or for our vegetarian friends, falafel) and bountiful toppings. When they ask if you want rice, YOU GIVE AN EMPHATIC 'YES' - the saffron rice is amazing.  At the end of the counter you have a generous portion of fresh, flavorful food. I love that they have multiple varieties of hummus every day (to be expected given the name), and each that I've tried so far is delicious. It's a good thing the flavors meld, because there isn't enough room in the bowl for it all without selections overlapping or stacking (i.e. hummus over your rice). This could be a minus to some folks.  A heads up - the parking is lousy (it is in a strip mall) and there aren't many seats inside. The soda is reasonably priced and has free refills, but only comes in one size, 12 ounce, which bugs my wife. Skip it for takeout and swing by Circle K.
